191501.name: River Crossing Map
191501.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Townscapes are simple, generic maps of typical locations you might find in any medieval or fantasy towns. They are meant to fill in the gaps and provide easy to print maps for expected or unexpected encounters. They are mapped out in typical 1 in. = 5 ft. map format.

Townscapes: River Crossing Map is a one-page map of a simple wooden bridge spaning a twenty-foot river. Also included are single-page road, river, and clearing tiles in case you want to expand the scene for a slightly bigger battleground.

Included for your convenience are several different formats including:

Full color map in a single .jpg (versions with and without grid)
High contrast black and white map in a single .jpg (great for printing on parchment textured paper)
Legal and A4-sized PDFs for printing on your home printer

D20 Cartographer also supports Virtual Table Top systems and includes:

100DPI gridless .png version with objects removed
An object file folder with .png objects for private reuse in other Virtual Table Top Maps
A RPTools (MapTools) VTT file with the map and object layer set up for you

191502.name: Stables Map
191502.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Townscapes are simple, generic maps of typical locations you might find in any medieval or fantasy towns. They are meant to fill in the gaps and provide easy to print maps for excepted or unexpected encounters. They are mapped out in typical 1 in. = 5 ft. map format.

Townscapes: Stables Map is a two-page (or 1 11x17 page) map of a simple, small-town riding stable to house your party's mounts, act as a ripe target for horse-thieves, or even a battleground in a zombie-ridden hamlet.

Included for your convenience are several different formats including:

Full color map in a single .jpg (versions with and without grid)
High contrast black and white map in a single .jpg (great for printing on parchment textured paper)
Legal and A4-sized PDFs for printing on your home printer

D20 Cartographer also supports Virtual Table Top systems and includes:

100DPI gridless .png version with objects removed
An object file folder with over 30 .png objects for private reuse in other Virtual Table Top Maps
A RPTools (MapTools) VTT file with vision blocking and objects set up for you

191503.name: Human Town
191503.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

What has transpired here and, more importantly, what is about to? Has your band of adventurers stumbled upon a fortified town in the depths of the wilderness? Is this the place the party’s solemn fighter has tried to forget, or one of many cities where your Rogue is still wanted for murder? Is this the centerpiece of your new campaign, or a milestone along the way? With D20 Cartographer, the story is in your hands!

Make your epic tale of adventure truly epic in scope: “Mega Townscapes” are full-featured encounter maps designed to fill your fantastic world! “Human Town” features a massive town center. With a base map measuring 72x48, this town is approximately four posters in size, but also includes supplemental interior maps for all structures, several with more than one floor. Print and VTT files for the entire town or individual buildings are included. The buildings include: An inn, taverm, magic goods shop, arms and armor shop, general store, travel goods store, warehouse, guild hall, barracks, temple, and several houses. All maps are in typical 1 inch = 5 feet scale.

Included for your convenience are several different formats including:

• Full-color maps in .jpg files (versions with and without grid)

• PDF files with images sliced up over multiple pages for small-format printers (both the entire town and individual structures)

D20 Cartographer also supports virtual table top (VTT) systems and includes:

• 100 DPI gridless maps with objects and dungeon dressing removed

• A folder with all ‘objects’ (over 100!) separate in .png format for use on this map or reuse on your private maps

• An RPTools MapTool VTT file with vision blocking and object layer set up for you

191504.name: Sony DualShock 4 Charging Station
191504.description:
User Summary

With Sony DualShock 4 Charging Station you can Charge two Dualshock controllers at the same time. When the controllers are fully charged it have auto standby function so you dont have to worry about keeping controllers plugged in all the time.

191505.name: PlayStation Gold Wireless Stereo Headset
191505.description:
Sony's wireless stereo headset allows users to hear both in game audio and voice chat. The headset runs independent of then HDMI, optical and A/V outputs, and instead connects wirelessly via a USB dongle (which can also be used to connect it to a PC or Mac). The headset requires system software update version 3.70. Other features include virtual surround sound (up to 7.1; media dependent) and on screen status notifications. Sony added an app for the PS4 that allows the user to change the sound settings of the headset. Several game developers have created settings just for their games.

Source: Wikipedia, "PlayStation Gold Wireless Stereo Headset", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

191506.name: Advanced Training: Leadership
191506.description:
From publisher blurb:

Some agents do more than take orders. They give them. A good team of spies should be organized to work as a team. Often, this means developing a plan and taking control of a tactical situation. Some agents excel in this, others do not. The agency to which the players’ agents belong offers an advanced leadership training program. Admins who want this added level of teamwork (and complexity) can opt to use this system by allowing one or more agents on the team to enroll in this program to learn advanced techniques in detection, interrogation, planning, and manipulation. He's the oil that makes the cogs in the team work well. He's the glue that binds them together. He's the man with the plan... he's a leader.

This is an Advanced Training option book for players and Admins to use in their games. It represents an option for agents to enroll in an advanced program offered by the agency. Enrolling increases the amount of experience points needed to go up in level, but provides the agent access to a series of leadership techniques he otherwise wouldn't have been entitled.

Your leader will establish a Plan or give Commands. He'll detect things that might harm his team, and build trust with dangerous people. He'll arrange for exfil when no other option remains. He'll identify and come up with ways to foil the plans of enemy leaders, or plant neurolinguistic suggestions on unsuspecting people. He'll keep his team safe while helping orchestrate the success of a mission. And when all is done, he'll light up a cigar and comment how much he loves it when a plan comes together!

191507.name: Wererats
191507.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bite Me! Wererats Skulks out of the Walls and into Your Game

Vermin! Sewer scum! And those are the polite names people call them.

Living hidden inside of and underneath great cities, wererats have to fight the prejudices of other races—including other lycanthropes—and the extermination attempts of civic-minded reformers just to stay alive, let alone to thrive in their hidden society.

Bite Me! Wererats is a 19-page supplement describing a race of natural shapechangers who just want to be left alone in their claustrophobic, vermin-filled underground warrens.

Bite Me! Wererats Contains:

Rules for creating wererat characters using the Bite Me! lycanthrope system, including new racial traits, archetypes (the Bully Slayer and the Sewer Druid), and feats (from Lost In The Crowd to Swarm Caller)
New wererat spells (from close quarters to virulence), magic items (from helm of ratkind to slimming oil), and equipment (from air sweetener to rat scent)
Details of wererat life and society.
Two completely statted (in both human and rat forms) ready-to-use NPCs.

191508.name: Villainous Archetypes Volume I
191508.description:
From publisher blurb:

It’s Good to Be Bad!

Sick of saving the world? Tired of being expected to leap at the chance to solve everyone’s petty problems? Have a thing for twirling mustaches and overly-elaborate deathtraps? Why not mix things up with a villainous character! At some point in their gaming career, everyone has considered playing an “evil campaign,” but with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game being devoted to goody-two-shoes heroes, it can sometimes be hard to find support. Want some evil options for your character? You’ve found them!

This book presents five new villainous archetypes for five different classes. Included are the grim experimenter, an alchemist archetype whose experimental mutagens can be used on others, and who excels at brewing poisons, the cutthroat mercenary, a pragmatic fighter archetype that focuses on demoralizing its foes with grisly displays, the divine scourge, an archetype for intolerant paladins intent on punishing even the slightest of misdeeds, the manhunter, a ranger archetype that specializes in hunting sentient creatures for sport, and the mad wizard, a wizard archetype for wizards whose powerful obsessions lead to great magical power.

Whether you're about to embark on a politically-themed campaign (such as Way of the Wicked, by Fire Mountain Games, or the first official Paizo adventure path made specifically for evil characters), or you just want an excuse to play an unrepentant, irredeemable villain, this book has lots of tantalizing options to offer. Even GMs can get in on the fun, as several of the archetypes here are perfect for villainous NPCs as well, and can make for exciting and memorable encounters.

191509.name: Villain Codex I: Foes for Fledgling Heroes
191509.description:
From publisher blurb:

Every good story needs an antagonist. Beowulf isn’t epic without Grendel; Harry Potter doesn’t become the Boy Who Lived without Voldemort; and without Darth Vader, Luke Skywalker is still toiling as an anonymous farmboy on Tatooine.

It's a superior villain makes a plot memorable.

The Villain Codex I: Foes for Fledgling Heroes presents 12 exciting, memorable NPCs for players, complete with stat blocks across a range of challenge ratings (3-8) to provide GMs with combat challenges their players won’t see coming.

191510.name: Blood & Grease
191510.description:
From publisher blurb:

A grim escape from rotten depths

The City in the Shadow of the Stolen Moon is a sprawling metropolis, choked with the smog and industrial waste from reckless magical manufacturing. Grim horrors stir in the caves and sewers beneath the city as uncontrolled magical waste awakens unnatural creatures. It is in this grim and deep darkness that unlikely heroes find themselves, heroes that will find dangerous and unknown life, brave toxic environments and climb their way through the filth and muck of a magical sewer to the bright and searing freedom of the desert above.

Blood & Grease is an adventure module designed for four 1st-level characters, written for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game and compatible with the 3.5 edition of the world's oldest RPG. Blood & Grease takes place in The City in the Shadow of the Stolen Moon in the Weeping Worlds campaign setting. This module is part 1 of the Sandscorned adventure path.

Features

A full 4-6 hour adventure for 4-5 level 1 characters.
Colour combat maps
Multiple custom creatures with full illustration
A gruesome exploration of fungal caverns and slime-soaked sewers

191511.name: Sanctum Secorum (Issue #07 - Jan 2016)
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
191511.description:
From publisher blurb:

There is a great deal of new material to bring to the table based on this story. Below is a list, by category and author, of what has been added to the Dark Acquisitions page by the Keepers of Mysteries, based on this show. Further contributions from friends of the library will also be found there as they arrive.

Character Classes

Half Giant - David Baity

Magic Items

Demon Stones - Bob Brinkman
Enchanted Cane - Bob Brinkman
Finding Light - Bob Brinkman

Monsters

Bammat - Bob Brinkman
Becky Til Hoppard - Jen Brinkman
Behinder - Bob Brinkman
Hoppard Kin - Jen Brinkman

Patrons

The Fiddler - Bob Brinkman

191512.name: Kuhno
191512.description:
Kuhno is an addition to the "Crazy Eights" genre. The aim of the game is to be the first to get rid of all cow cards and to yell out at the right time. Instead of matching numbers and colors there are four discard piles around a central cow pat. The fly on top of this cow pat dictates which spots a cow needs to have in order to be allowed to graze when and where.

Kuhno is the perfect fit for everybody who either loves Crazy Eights already or is otherwise ready to fall for this great addition to the genre. Not surprisingly, the aim of the game is to be the first to get rid of all cow cards and to yell out at the right time. Instead of simply matching numbers and colors though there are four discard piles around a central cow pat. The fly on top of this cow pat dictates which spots a cow needs to have in order to be allowed to graze when and where.

191513.name: Out of the Dark
191513.description:
(publisher blurb)

Trapped! An old adversary has captured you for imagined slights, and as punishment sealed you into a deadly maze of monsters. With only a single weapon, your runes, and a magic torch, you must escape with your life!

191514.description: Spring ins Feld! is a flower picking game with a "dice pawn". The gardener pawn is made of wood, with a transparent hat that has a flower die inside of it. Whenever the gardener jumps from one flower bed to another, the die will automatically spin. The player who moved him gets to pick all matching flowers. The first full flower basket ends the game.
191514.name: Spring ins Feld!

191517.name: Game Trade Magazine (Issue 191 - Jan 2016)
rpgissuearticle: Firefly: The Game - Kalidasa Rim Space Expansion
Pocket Imperium from Passport Game Studios
The Horus Heresy: Betrayal at Calth
191517.description:
Game Trade Magazine
Issue 191
January 2016


Celebrating 15 years of Munchkin
Shape the course of a galaxy far, far away...
DC Comics' iconic heroes take the fight to the HeroClix Arena

191518.name: Meeple Monthly (Issue 36 - Dec 2015)
rpgissuearticle: V-Wars: A Game of Blood and Betrayal
191518.description:
Meeple Monthly
Issue 36
December 2015


Steve Jackson Games: 2016
Intel on a New Kind of War by IDW Games
Ed Greenwood's Worlds
Arcane Wonders: Dominating the Arena
Darkness Comes Rattling

191519.name: Hugo Troll Race
191519.description:
Hugo Troll Race is an action video game in the Hugo franchise, developed by Hugo Games and published by Krea Medie in 2012 for the Android system mobile devices and made free-to-play in 2013. It was also released as Hugo Troll Race HD for the iPad; a PC version was released by Software Pyramide in Germany. It is a remake of the "handcar" minigame from the 1992 Amiga game Hugo - På Nye Eventyr (released as just Hugo in an export version outside Denmark), which was itself based on the early 1990s scenarios from the TV game show Hugo.

Source: Wikipedia, "Hugo Troll Race", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

191522.name: Personal Trainer: Walking
191522.description:
Personal Trainer: Walking allows up to four users to track their walking, jogging or running activities through a series of graphs, charts and statistics, as well as set goals for themselves. The game is packaged with two wireless pedometers that communicate to the game the user's walking data. Additional pedometers will be sold separately.

The game uses Miis to track each user's progress, and allows users to either create a Mii in-game (A first for the Nintendo DS), or wirelessly transfer an existing Mii from a Wii console's Mii Channel to their Nintendo DS. The game also features a number of minigames to unlock, and users can also upload their data online via the Nintendo Wi-Fi Connection to add to weekly leaderboards and a world step count that plots a virtual trek across the solar system.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Personal_Trainer:_Walking

191524.name: Walloo!
191524.description:
The poor little kangaroos are feeling bored! They've seen a lot of little rabbits hopping around, and have decided to try and catch them and make some new friends.The rabbits have other ideas; there are too many carrots in need of munching, so they'd really rather not get caught!

The players each take charge of a group of rabbits, trying to keep them away from the kangaroos. To succeed, they'll need their wits about them, and may be just a bit of luck.

191525.name: Star Wars: The Card Game – Galactic Ambitions
boardgamefamily: Star Wars: The Card Game LCG
191525.description:
Description from the publisher:

Two great powers struggle for the fate of the galaxy across the Star Wars saga. On one side, you find the fledgling Rebel Alliance, led by a few brave politicians and desperately fighting for the hearts and minds of people on countless planets. Opposing the Rebels stands the might of the Galactic Empire, a monolithic government ruled by the Sith Lords, Darth Vader and Darth Sidious.

Galactic Ambitions pits these two powers against each other in a struggle for the galaxy itself. Like previous deluxe expansions, the twenty-six new objective sets included in Galactic Ambitions fix the spotlight on two factions—the Sith and the Rebel Alliance—but every faction receives cards that push your decks in new directions. Here, you’ll find an assortment of iconic characters to include in your decks, including Darth Vader, Emperor Palpatine, Leia Organa, and Mon Mothma, Kanan Jarrus, and the Inquisitor from Star Wars: Rebels. Whether you’re fighting to free the galaxy or to squelch any trace of resistance, Galactic Ambitions offers new strategies and cards to support new deck types.

191526.description: This level is a bonus level released in 2015 during the holiday season on the Libellud web site. It is labeled as Promo Level 1.
191526.name: Loony Quest: Christmas Promo

191527.name: Skies of Fury
191527.description:
From publisher blurb:

A 60 page Kickstarter-exclusive book from Beyond the Skies' Kickstarter campaign.

Projected contents are adventures and short stories.

The PDF version was available with most pledges, while the softcover version was as an add-on.

boardgameintegration: Soldier Emperor
Soldier Emperor
191528.description:
From the Avalanche Press Website:

Between 1767 and 1846, war and intrigue dominated the Indian sub-continent. War constantly flared between the Indian kingdoms, both against one another and against the British and French interlopers. The Europeans, meanwhile, also busily fought each other.

Indian Empires is a complete game, using the same game engine as Soldier Emperor, our strategic game of the Napoleonic Wars. It can be played separately, or together with Soldier Emperor; our Dreams of Empire book includes a linking map and the rules and pieces for its use.

Indian Empires is a new edition of our long out-of print Soldier Raj. It includes over a dozen scenarios from Hyder Ali's defeat of the British in the First Mysore War in 1767 to Britain's final conquest of the Sikhs in 1846. Colorful leaders of the time are all present: Hyder Ali and Tippoo of Mysore. Sir Arthur Wellesley, the "sepoy general" who would become Duke of Wellington. The brilliant Madhav Rao of the Marathas. France's Admiral Suffren. Zaman Shah of Afghanistan, and the Sikh ruler Ranjit Singh. These and more lead your armies.

The playing pieces are decadently thick tiles; pieces like the Mysore Tiger Soldier or the Maratha War Elephant are original works of art by Terry Moore Strickland. As in Soldier Emperor, successful card play is a key to victory.

As in Soldier Emperor, players command their nation's military, political and economic destiny. The map is a painting of South Asia, with a network of areas and routes between them laid over it. Generals move their armies along these routes, attempting to conquer territory for their nation. Fleets control the seas around India; the locals have very little seapower, and Britain outnumbers France on the seas.

Combat is resolved by dice rolls, with larger armies casting more dice. Good generalship is even more crucial in India than in Europe. Players win by taking the most territory, or by destroying their nation's enemies.
191528.name: Soldier Emperor: Indian Empires

191529.name: Chefs
191529.description:
The objective of the game is to get as many meal cards with as many points as possible, and exchange them for steps. The person who passes field 20 and gets the farthest in the last round, wins the game.

In round players:
a) place their action markers.
b) executing actions like taking ingredients, cooking, exchanging cards, preparing foods or stepping their chef further on the game board.

The game ends at the end of the round where at least one chef has passed the field 20.

191530.name: Bugs
191530.description:
From the publisher´s website:
Professor Bugsy loves bugs. To be able to observe them he wants to catch as many of them as possible. But what bug would want to get into his matchbox? Life is much better outside the box! The bugs are on holiday right now. They’re relaxing and swimming in their summer houses. When the fun ends, sadly they have to go home. The road is dangerous, because the professor is lurking on the path leading to the city… How many bugs will get home to Bugsville?

Players roll the dice. First die shows the bugs who left the town or being catched by professor or escaped from the matchbox. But if magnifying glass is rolled the matchbox moves as many steps further than the other die shows to catch all the bugs.

Players lost the game if 4 or more bugs are catched and there are no bugs left at the summer house. Otherwise players win.

191531.name: Grand Prix
191531.description:
From the publisher´s website:
The first entry into the history of car racing, the victory of horsepower without horses. Go ahead gentlemen, the world awaits you! The racers speed along trackless roads and deserted landscapes to win the most exalted of prizes, and the glory for being the most daring of drivers. The first and greatest race in the annals of history can only be won by someone who, defying all odds, manages to drive his automobile through the finish line. We can admit though, that beside their skills the racers have to posses a small amount of luck as well.

Players play simultanously the cards with numbers 1-6. Now player reveal the cards and starting to move their cars in increasing numbers on their cards. If Your car ends the turn on the place where is another card or obstacle you must put Your car back to the space from which they started the movement.

Player who finishes first is the winner.

191532.name: Cookie & Cream
191532.description:
From the back of the game box

The treasured Moon Festival for the Rabbit Clan cannot happen until someone finds the moon! Two determined bunnies named Cookie and Cream must work together to uncover the mystery of the missing Moon!

Cooperative puzzle-solving
Work with your partner to move through levels solving puzzles, disarming traps and evading enemies!

Wireless & Wi-Fi compatible
Wireless Mode allows 2-player co-op Story play and WiFi Mode for 4-player battle action.

191533.name: Shayō
191533.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Devastated a long time ago by the Tenbatsu [divine wrath], ruthless samurai, wandering techs looking for relics of the ancient world, blind priestesses or mad exorcists, messengers traveling across the wastelands, the characters swore allegiance to the neo-shogunate, the only power now able to protect the land from the fearsome oni and mutants.

Will you save the empire from the ghosts of the past?

191534.description:
Sabotile: Isles of Hexoté is a competitive 2-6 player capture-the-flag game with tile management based progression.

As a chieftain of one of the six tribes on the island of Hexoté, you will start in your people's village outskirts and attempt to bring back your sacred totem, stolen by the god of chaos Mesba, from the center temple. However, it has been mixed with the other tribes' and you must deduce yours by carrying totems to villages and using the ever-changing land to bolster yourself and impede the rest. Influence the board by placing or taking tiles with various powers to affect the game and take back what is rightfully yours!

Moving across tiles, any time you or another tribe chieftain ends movement on one, it activates, the resulting effect taking place. This simple mechanism opens up all sorts of opportunity for strategy and sabotage.
191534.name: Sabotile: Isles of Hexoté
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode #2 – Sabotile

191535.name: Killer Bees!
191535.description:
User Summary

You control a swarm of bees agains deadly robots while avoiding green enemy killer bees. A original Odyssey 2 game and one of the best.

191536.name: How to Draw Fantasy Art and RPG Maps: Step by Step Cartography for Gamers and Fans
191536.description:
From the back of the book:

How to Draw Fantasy Art and RPG Maps will teach you how to bring your fictional realm to life with simple step-by-step instructions for drawing authentic fantasy maps. Set the stage for adventure by illustrating domains, castles and battle lines, mountains, forests and sea monsters! Learn to create completely unique and fully functional RPG maps time and time again, maps from which your world can be built.

191537.name: P.T. Barnum's Acrobats!
191537.description:
User Summary

A balloon popping game where one or two acrobats may pop balloons while trying not to fall on the floor. The two player game is cooperative: players take turns on the bouncing ramp and on the sky popping balloons and scoring points.

boardgamehonor: 2016 Deutscher Spiele Preis Best Children's Game Winner
191538.description:
Leo the lion's mane is far too long and he risks looking shaggy and losing the respect of his fellow animals — but those same animals keep stopping him to chit-chat while on the way to a haircut. Can you get this king of the jungle to the barber shop in time?

In Leo, players need to help Leo reach the barber shop before it closes for the day. To set up, place all of the animal tiles face down, shuffle them, then create a track that leads from Leo's bed to Bobo's Barber Shop. Set the clock to 8:00 a.m. Each player starts a number of cards in hand.

On a turn, a player plays one card to move Leo ahead 1-4 spaces on the track, then reveals the animal tile on which Leo landed. If the tile is the same color as the card just played, the clock remains at the same time as it was at the start of the turn; if the tile has a different color, however, the clock moves ahead 1-5 hours depending on the animal depicted. Poor Leo! If the clock reaches 8:00 p.m. before Leo arrives at the barber shop, the round ends and Leo must return home in order to try again the next day. Turn all face-up tiles face down again.

If the players manage to get Leo to the barber shop within five days to get him a trim, they win!
boardgameversion: English/German second edition with nomination for Kinderspiel des Jahres 2016 logo
191538.name: Leo
boardgamepodcastepisode: Ep 036 – BGG Spring Con & Spiel des Jahres 2016 Nominees
Ep 039 – Fleet, Origins, and Pokemon Go!
Ep 040 – The 2016 Spiel des Jahres Winners!
MN 0113 We Discuss the Spiel des Jahres Nominees for 2016

191539.name: Marienkäfer, flieg
191539.description:
Marienkäfer, flieg: The players start on the orange spaces on the outher ring. The first player to reach the center space wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. Direction of movement from each space follows the direction of the antlers of the pictured lady bug. If the antlers point to another ring, the player changes rings and moves in the direction of the first space on that ring.

The game board has another game on the backside: Kinderglücksspiel. To win this game the players have to move from one of the outher starting spaces to the center space. Movement is determined by two dice of which the player may chose one to make his move. The players move their meeples one space in the direction that matches their chosen die.
If a meeple gets on a space that is already occupied by another meeple, the later one must start anew.

The game was published in the 1980s.

191540.description:
Cacao: Chocolatl features four modules for the Cacao base game, and these modules can be used individually or in any combination with the other modules.

1. The chocolate module includes three chocolate maker tiles, three chocolate markets and twenty wooden chocolate markers. Chocolate is made out of cacao at the chocolate maker tiles and can be sold at a high price but only on special markets.

2. The huts module includes twelve double-sided huts you can acquire during the game. They give their owner special powers during the game or extra points when fulfilling specific conditions.

3. The irrigation module includes three special plantations where you can harvest a lot of cacao fruits but must pay with water.

4. The maps module includes a preview board for two more tiles that are visible near the draw pile. Each player receives two map tiles at the beginning of the game, and for each tile spent he can also choose from the preview board when filling up spaces on the board.
191540.name: Cacao: Chocolatl
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cacao Review with the Game Boy Geek

191541.name: Koi-Koi Japan: Hanafuda playing cards
191541.description:
User Summary

Hanafuda playing cards were designed in Japan centuries ago after Western playing cards were outlawed. The cards are based on the four seasons and 12 months of the year.

Koi-Koi is a set collecting game played using these classic cards. The game includes a tutorial mode as well as a guide to the sets and their point values. Koi-Koi also includes a "push your luck" mechanic, as each time you complete a set, you will be asked if you want to continue playing or call for scoring. Only the person who calls for scoring will get points for the current round. There are 12 rounds in each game, though the game may end early if you reduce your opponent to 0 points.

191542.name: Koi-Koi Japan: Koi-Koi Enjoy Pack
191542.description:
User Summary

Adds an alternate opponent as well as alternate card backs and decorations to the base game.

boardgameintegration: Ricochet Robots
Ricochet Robots
191543.description:
Micro Robots, a simultaneous play game inspired by Alex Randolph's classic Ricochet Robots, challenges players to quickly determine how a robot can move from one spot on the grid to another.

To set up, choose to use the black or copper side of the four game boards, then arrange them in a 2x2 square. Each game board shows nine dice, and once arranged the completed grid shows 36 dice, with the dice being numbered 1-6 and showing six colors, with each combination of number and color appearing exactly once. Roll the color die and number die to determine the starting location for the transparent robot, then mark this space with the transparent starting token.

In a round, roll the two dice to determine the target space; you can mark this space with a transparent victory token or simply have everyone remember which space they're trying to reach. Everyone simultaneously tries to figure out how to move the robot to the target space, and to move the robot, it must move orthogonally to a space that shares either the color or number of its current location. If the robot starts on "3-green", for example, it can move orthogonally to any space that shows either a 3 or is green; if you'd move it to "5-green", it can now once again move orthogonally to any space that shows either a 5 or is green; and so on.

As soon as a player has a solution, they yell out the number of moves, then take the robot and demonstrate the solution. If the solution takes exactly the number of moves claimed, the player earns a victory token; if not, the player gives one of their victory tokens (if they have any) to the player with the fewest tokens. In either case, the former target space becomes the new starting space for the next round.

If any player possesses five victory tokens, they win! If the 25 victory tokens are distributed before someone collects five, then whoever holds the most tokens wins, with ties being possible.

Expert Micro Robots players can increase the challenge of the game by placing the target victory token on the board, then rolling the two dice once again. The players must now determine a solution that first moves the robot to the space showing on the dice, then to the final destination.

The transparent robot in Micro Robots can also be used in Ricochet Robots. This robot moves like any other robot in that game except that for an additional move it can pass through a wall instead of stopping at it. It cannot move through the central barrier or the exterior walls, and the only target space on which it can land is the colored vortex.
191543.name: Micro Robots
boardgamepodcastepisode: DJ125: Micro Robots (2016) Andreas Kuhnekath

191544.name: Nancy Drew: #32 Sea of Darkness
191544.description:
The celebrated ship “Heerlijkheid,” is usually the centerpiece of an Icelandic town’s local festival. Now that its captain has disappeared, the renovated vessel has become an eerie distraction. Did Captain Magnus sail away with a legendary treasure, or was he carried off into the night? Take the helm as detective Nancy Drew and set a course for the Sea of Darkness!

Source: The Publisher Website.

191545.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Infernal Relics
videogamecompilation: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Expansion Season Pass 1
191545.description:
User Summary

Adds Heroes The Argent Adept and NightMist; Villains Akash'Bhuta, Apostate, The Ennead, and GloomWeaver; and Environments Realm of Discord and Tomb of Anubis to the base game.

191546.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Rook City
videogamecompilation: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Expansion Season Pass 1
191546.description:
User Summary

Rook City expands the base game with Heroes Expatriette and Mr. Fixer; Villains The Chairman, The Matriarch, Plague Rat, and Spite; and Environments Pike Industrial Complex and Rook City.

191547.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Mini-Pack 1
videogamecompilation: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Expansion Season Pass 1
191547.description:
User Summary

Contains Hero Unity, Villain Ambuscade, and Environment Silver Gulch, 1883 as an add-on to the base game.

191548.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Mini-Pack 2
videogamecompilation: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Expansion Season Pass 1
191548.description:
User Summary

Adds Hero The Scholar, Villain Miss Information, and Environment The Final Wasteland to the base game.

191549.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Mini-Pack 3
videogamecompilation: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Expansion Season Pass 1
191549.description:
User Summary

Adds Hero Guise, Villain Wager Master, and Environment Omnitron IV to the base game.

191550.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Shattered Timelines
videogamecompilation: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Expansion Season Pass 1
191550.description:
User Summary

Includes Heroes Omnitron-X and Chrono-Ranger; Villains Iron Legacy, The Dreamer, Kismet, and La Capitan; and Environments Time Cataclysm and The Block to add to the base game.

191552.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Expansion Season Pass 1
videogamehonor: 2015 Golden Geek Best Board Game App Nominee
videogamecompilation: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Infernal Relics
Sentinels of the Multiverse: Rook City
Sentinels of the Multiverse: Shattered Timelines
191552.description:
User Summary

The Expansion Season Pass 1 contains 7 expansions for the base Sentinels of the Multiverse game, adding a total of 11 new Heroes, 17 new Villains, and 11 new Environments to the base game, as well as access to all the related variants released in computer format.

191556.name: Turbo Pug
191556.description:
User Summary

Selecting from various pugs (and other animals) you run and avoid various pits and obstacles, gaining points as you stay alive.

191557.name: Beep Boop
191557.description:
Beep Boop is a kid-friendly, strategic, competitive card game about battling robots. Why? Because who doesn't love robots?

In the game, players play cards to build and upgrade their robot while sabotaging other players. When a robot is built, players can begin attacking each other. The last robot standing wins!

191558.description:
When a clown cries we all cry. In this game of Crying With a Sad Clown you must try to cry the most by playing cards from your hand and gathering the tear tokens.

Game Contents:
60 Cards of Four Suits (Man, Woman, Child, Clown)
24 Tear Tokens

Game Setup:
Shuffle and deal all the cards to all the players. Every player should receive the same amount of cards.

Game Play:
The starting player chooses 1-3 cards from their hand and plays at least one face up in front of their play area. All other players in order play 1-3 cards either face up or face down in front of their play area. After all players have played a card,flip over any face down cards.

Score each “trick” as follows: The man (blue) and woman (yellow) act as a group. The baby (purple) and clown (red) are a group. The group with the least amount of cards wins the “trick” and takes a tear token of the same color as the card they played in player order. If the groups are equal in size, no player wins a token. After each trick, the starting player is the next player in order. The game ends when 3 of the 4 color tear tokens are depleted or when all of one player's cards have been played. The winner is the player with the most tokens within the widest variety of colors.
191558.name: Crying With A Sad Clown
boardgamepodcastepisode: Dice Tower News 510 - Mar 4 - 2016

191559.name: Warhammer 40,000: Armageddon – Ork Hunters
191559.description:
Ork Hunters is an expansion of Warhammer 40,000: Armageddon, set shortly after the end of the Second War of Armageddon, and it adds a new chapter to this epic saga!

Follow the deeds of the Ork Hunters and the others elements of the Steel Legion in their effort to cleanse the Planet of every menace once and for all!

This time reinforcements are not expected. No Space Marine forces remain on world in the immediate post war environment, and no Space Marine units will appear in this DLC campaign. This will be a battle of only Imperial units, giving it a unique disposition compared to the main game!

Four new Ork units make an appearance: Feral Wildboyz, Huntas, Boarboyz, and Junkas, alongside at least six new Ork hunter infantry types: Ork Hunter Company Command, Infantry, Flamers, Anti-Tank Support, Fire Support and Snipers.

This campaign is an expansion for Warhammer 40,000: Armageddon and requires Warhammer 40,000: Armageddon to play.

Source: The Publisher Website.

191560.description:
In each opening round of the trick-taking card game Union, players take turns using their voting tokens that are randomly drawn from a bag for starting player, trump, super trump, number of cards discarded, and the value of tricks taken. Once the starting player is determined, that player chooses a partner, then the teams play out the round based on the rules they collectively chose.

In this unique three suited trick taking game, players also have the option of playing -5 point cards out of sequence that will outcome the trick.

Contents:
5 Player Tokens
1 Bag
32 Rule Tokens
5 Starting Rule Tiles
48 Cards in Three Suits (Yellow, Black, and White)
10 Cards that are -5 Points per trick (Red)
191560.name: Union

191561.name: Sector 90
videogameversion: English / EU ZX Spectrum Cassette edition
191561.description:
From the inlay:

Are you: Dedicated to victory no matter the cost?

Are you: A terran patriot?

Do you have nerves of steel?

If you have then perhaps you can be a successful Drop Commando and help Earth in it's battle against the enemy Aliens.

User Summary

In Sector 90 the player takes the role of a Drop Commando sent to open a chink in the defences of the Toor-Tamin, who have been at war with Earth for 200 years.

Drop Commandos are dropped in to enemy areas using powerful teleporters. These are powerful enough to punch through strong defences, but can only send one Commando at a time, are one way only, and cannot hit their destination with precision.

The Drop Commando must therefore search for the centre of the Sector 90 "Sector Intelligence Unit". To do so he must fight his way from where he is teleported in, and make his way through various locked doors where puzzles need to be solved.

At the centre, he must plant a bomb then escape within a 90 second time limit. If he succeeds, a gap will be opened in the Toor-Tamin defences, allowing the Terran fleet to break through.

191562.description: Billionaire Banshee: Australia Booster consists of ten new Perk and ten new Quirk cards for Billionaire Banshee that feature Australian-based traits.
191562.name: Billionaire Banshee: Australia Booster

191563.name: Star Duel
191563.description:
It is a period of war. The intergalactic empires of Enate and Kurth have grown desperate as scare resources have forced them to aggressively expand across the universe. They use planetary nodes as instruments of war, consuming entire star systems in the blink of an eye. Now the two empires compete for the final goal: Complete domination of the universe.

In Star Duel, you control strategic galactic nodes to gain Energy, Minerals, Population, and Influence, then use those resources to crush your opponent.

GAME OVERVIEW
In Star Duel, players take turns activating, exhausting, and moving their nodes while also attacking the nodes of their opponent. The player who best manages his network of nodes will emerge victorious.

TURN OVERVIEW
At the beginning of each turn, the players choose two of their Node Programming cards, orient them to match their coordinates for a node, and reveal the cards to the other player. The player that programmed the lower number goes first. After the first player completes his actions for the turn, the second player performs his actions and then a new turn begins.

On a player's turn, the player may perform each of the following actions one time and in any order:

Execute Program [target a node, replace a node, or produce energy]
Exhaust node;
Move node.

WINNING THE GAME
A player wins immediately if his opponent is ever reduced to 0 influence or 0 population. Additionally, a player wins if he controls all available nodes at the end of a round.

191565.name: Anonima Gidierre (Numero 91 - Gennaio/Marzo 2016)
rpgissuearticle: Anonima Gidierre e le quote rosa
Supernaturalia 3 - Goran e la pentolaccia maledetta
Xcom, o come trasformare il salotto in una sala operativa
XXII trofeo Rill "Il miglior racconto fantastico"

boardgamehonor: 2016 Golden Geek Best Family Board Game Nominee
191572.description:
The accessible and clever game Animals on Board features a two-tiered cardboard ark that will hold each player's animal tiles. At the start of the game, each player draws three animal tiles, chooses one of these tiles, and places it on a bracket of his ark without showing it to the other players.

The leftover animals that players initially drew begin forming what will become a single animal collective in the center of the table. The total number of animals in the collective is based on the number of players, but one animal in the collective will always be face-down. Each player also starts with one food crate and may never have more than five food crates at any time.

On each turn, a player has two options: (a) split a collective of animals into two groups and take a food crate, or (b) take one of the animal collectives into their ark by paying a food crate for each animal in that group. As players choose their group of animals, they drop out of the turn. The first player to drop out of a turn starts the next turn. The game ends when an ark has at least ten animals on board.

Before scoring, all animals in pairs are discarded because a guy called Noah claims all animal pairs for himself. Single animals score the points imprinted on the tile (from 1-5) and herds of animals automatically score five points each. Remaining food crates also score one point each.
191572.name: Animals on Board

Episode 32 - Holiday Gift Giving Guide
Episode 74- Antarctica
HLG 6: Samen
HLG-EXTRA 5: Spellenspektakel 2016
RDTN Episode 97: Reviews of Tyrants of the Underdark, Simurgh, Mystic Vale, My Village, Tides of Madness and Others
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 67!!!
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 80

191573.name: Wars of Napoleon
191573.description:
From the Publisher: http://www.matrixgames.com/products/593/details/Wars.of.Napo...

AGEod goes back to the Napoleonic era and delivers the most detailed and comprehensive strategy game ever created about a time of struggle and conquest that forged modern Europe.

The engine has been refined to better represent the peculiarities of the period, allowing players to think and act as commanders of the Napoleonic era.

You are now able to manage the complexities of armies organization and logistics in a very detailed political setting, where each contender plays a vital part to the final outcome.

Establish your dynasty over most of Europe as Napoleon, or get rid of the Revolutionary tyrant as Britain. Also play as one of the other main contenders of the time such as Austria, Russia, Prussia, Spain or the Ottoman Empire and emerge amongst the victorious powers!

191574.name: Amnesia: Memories
191574.description:
User Summary

After a faerie named Orion collides with you, you lose all of your memories. Now the two of you are stuck together until you can find out who you are. In the meantime, you'll need to figure out which of the people who claim to be part of your life you can really trust. And don't forget trying to sort out your relationship with your latest boyfriend ... if he's telling the truth.

191575.name: 1931: Scheherazade at the Library of Pergamum
191575.description:
User Summary

You are Scheherazade, the brilliant daughter of vanished archaeologists, and you have just graduated high school and are ready for the high adventures of a globe-trotting college education. Will you find your parents? Will you find love? Will you gain the respect of the scholarly world?

191576.name: Deathless: The City's Thirst
191576.description: You're sent to negotiate water rights with a tribe of scorpion people, and from there, your adventures get weirder. Play corporate politics as you try to keep water flowing from The Red King Corporation or fail miserably and watch your city dry up and die.

191577.name: Date Warp
191577.description:
Five days ago, Janet left her dorm to go on a date.

She never returned.

Was she kidnapped? Murdered? Did she run away? Will she ever be seen again?

The choices you make can change her fate and help her find romance or destruction in one of eleven surprising endings!

Source: The Publisher Website.

191578.name: Black Closet
videogamehonor: 2016 IGF Awards Excellence in Narrative Nominee
191578.description:
9 AM Monday morning. A report lands on your desk: Jeanette's monogrammed silver locket has gone missing. The last time she definitely remembers having it, she was walking in the Field with her friend Susan. Shifty hallmate Ashley had also been admiring the locket recently.

Do you:

Drag Ashley in for interrogation?
Comb the Field for clues?
Try to stimulate Jeanette's memory?
Put Susan under surveillance?

Solve the case quickly, and everyone will applaud your leadership. Be too heavy-handed in your approach, and public opinion will turn against you. Let a thief slip through your fingers to strike again, and the whole school's reputation will suffer.

This is no ordinary high school! Here the daughters of the rich and famous are polished and prepared for their futures on the world stage. Reputation is everything, and the competition is cutthroat... sometimes literally.

Can you survive until your graduation?

Features:
Randomly-generated mysteries to solve; a new story every game
Complete cases to earn points and level up your minions' skills
RPG-style dialog - shape your character by choosing what you say
Pursue friendship or romance in an elite all-girls school

Source: The Publisher Website.

Yu-Gi-Oh! Dice Masters
191579.description:
Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Dice Masters is a dice-building game patterned after Quarriors! that features custom dice representing various characters from the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (TMNT) universe. Unlike other Dice Masters sets, TMNT Dice Masters is sold in as a contained set that gives you all the dice and cards that you need to play. This is the first Dice Masters set that is sold as a contained set without the possibility to expand it with boosters.

In the game, each player brings a set of dice to the table; these form the player's team, from which only they can purchase dice. In addition, each player brings two basic action cards, which are placed in the center of the table; both players can purchase them.

During a turn, a player draws and rolls a number of their dice, purchases additional dice, and fields character dice to attack the other player. A player wins once the opposing player has been reduced to zero life.

TMNT Dice Masters is one of several planned Dice Masters games, all of which can be intermixed (or played alone).
191579.name: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Dice Masters
boardgameaccessory: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Dice Masters: Dice Bag
Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Dice Masters: Playmat
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 015 – Top 10 Mechanisms

191580.description:
Alternate Art promo card for Marvel Dice Masters: Uncanny X-Men card #35 Ant-Man: Biophysicist.

Obtainable by by competing in the monthly WizKids Organized Play in-store event "Ant-Man"

191581.description:
Alternate Art promo card for Marvel Dice Masters: Age of Ultron card #105 Wasp: Bio-Electric Blasts.

Obtainable by competing in the monthly WizKids Organized Play in-store event "Ant-Man" or as a prize from official Wizkids tournaments.

Alternate Art promo card for Marvel Dice Masters: Age of Ultron card #102 Star-Lord: Reluctant Prince.

Obtainable by competing in the monthly WizKids Organized Play in-store event "Thanos Imperative" or as a prize from official Wizkids tournaments.

191583.description:
Alternate Art promo card for Marvel Dice Masters: The Amazing Spider-Man card #69 Spider-Man: Great Responsibility.

Obtainable by purchasing the Marvel Dice Masters: The Amazing Spider-Man Collector’s Box, or as a prize from attending official WizKids tournaments.
boardgameaccessory: Marvel Dice Masters: The Amazing Spider-Man
191583.name: Marvel Dice Masters: The Amazing Spider-Man – Spider-Man: Great Responsibility Alternate Art Promo

191584.name: Kensington-Opoly
191584.description: Build your fortune as you buy, sell and trade properties from the Kensington neighborhood in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. Don't worry it's classic Monopoly fun! Take a ride on Huntingdon El Stop, buy a neighborhood store, or buy up All of the stores — it’s your turn to get rich! You’ll take a spin around the board. Roll your dice and move your favorite game piece. Prove your skills as a deal maker. Pass YOUSE, collect $250.00, take a Destiny card or head over to Fate space as you wheel and deal your way to the top. But remember to stay out of The Sweat Box! Bring back those old neighborhood memories.

191585.name: Port Richmondopoly
191585.description: Build your fortune as you buy, sell and trade the properties. It’s like classic Monopoly fun!

191586.name: Slash: PAXspansion 2015
boardgameintegration: Slash: Romance without boundaries
Slash: Romance without boundaries
191586.description:
Slash is a card-based party game in which players compete to create the best romantic fan fiction pairing. Everybody gets a hand of their favorite characters from pop culture, history, and literature. The matchmaker selects one from her hand and places it face up on the table. For a bit more storytelling, the matchmaker can request that each player narrate some portion of the relationship they are attempting to create. Maybe it's the first date, or their wedding day, or the moment when they realized they belonged together.

Each player in turn selects a possible 'ship for that character using a card from their hand, narrating as necessary and hoping that the matchmaker chooses theirs — but if she doesn't, you can always narrate the tale of this destined connection to win the favor of the table and overrule the matchmaker. Play continues until one player has accumulated 20 points worth of characters.

Slash: PAXspansion 2015, which works as both a standalone game and an expansion for Slash: Romance without boundaries, has forty new characters and five blank cards, including Terrible Teenage Poets, Gary Gygax, and a $20,000 gaming table.

191587.name: Slash: Nerdlesque GGC 2015
boardgameintegration: Slash: Romance without boundaries
Slash: Romance without boundaries
191587.description:

Slash: Nerdlesque GGC 2015, which works as both a standalone game and an expansion for Slash: Romance without boundaries, has forty new characters and five blank cards, including Xenomorphs, Dr. Watson, and the classic android Maria.

Slash: Nerdlesque 2015, which works as both a standalone game and an expansion for Slash: Romance without boundaries, has forty new characters and five blank cards, including Martian rockstars, Canadian clones, and wrestling legends.

191589.name: Slash: Shipwreck October 2014
boardgameintegration: Slash: Romance without boundaries
Slash: Romance without boundaries
191589.description:
Slash is a card-based party game in which players compete to create the best romantic fan fiction pairing. Everybody gets a hand of their favorite characters from pop culture, history, and literature. The matchmaker selects one from her hand and places it face up on the table. Each player in turn selects a possible 'ship for that character using a card from their hand, narrating as necessary and hoping that the matchmaker chooses theirs — but if she doesn't, you can always narrate the tale of this destined connection to win the favor of the table and overrule the matchmaker. Play continues until one player has accumulated 20 points worth of characters.

Slash: Shipwreck October 2014, which works as both a standalone game and an expansion for Slash: Romance without boundaries, has forty literary characters and five blank cards, including Faceless Old Woman, Giant Space Octopi, and Clint Eastwood. Can you find them a love connection?

191590.name: Slash: There's a Fan Fic for That...
191590.description:
Slash: There's a Fan Fic for That... is an alternate set of rules that provides a new way to use the character cards in Slash: Romance with boundaries or one of the Slash spinoff sets.

Each player selects a character card, then takes a role in a scenario set in a location such as a coffee shop, the old west, or high school. The player must act out scenes from a typical fan fiction while being both the character (e.g., Orphan Black, Commander Shepherd, Veronica Mars) and the role (sheriff, jock, cheerleader).

191591.name: Beholden
191591.description:
From the introduction:

Imagine a man who finds you perfect in every way.

You are a deity, normally above mortals, but the depths of his passion demand a response. You find yourself deeply ambivalent about his desire. You decide to put him through some painful trials.

User summary:

Although Beholden was published as "A solo RPG", essentially it requires the Beloved rules to play. It is a variant game using those rules, but they are not fully included in the document.

191592.name: Within My Clutches: A Supervillain's Lament
rpg: Within My Clutches: A Supervillain's Lament
191592.description:
User summary:

The game uses dice pools of D6 to resolve action checks, though character generation does not specify generic Attributes or Skills. Instead, characters have certain narrative traits such as wants and goals, and they gain achievements during play. In addition to a character, players also control the actions of "supporting cast", or essentially henchmen.

191593.name: Haiku Warrior
191593.description:
(from the back of the box)

A tabletop RPG adventure told entirely through haiku!

From the creator of "Drinking Quest" comes an easy-to-learn Tabletop RPG for 1-4 players. Fight monsters, find hats, forage for food all while taking in the nuance and cunning of haiku!

191594.name: Wheel of Fortune (WiiU)
191594.description:
User Summary

Spin the wheel along with Pat Sajak and Vanna White on the virtual version of America's game!

191595.description: King's Forge: Glassworks adds glass as a new material with which to work in King's Forge. The expansion includes new "glass" material dice, new items that require glass to craft, and new places to gather glass for your workshop.
191595.name: King's Forge: Glassworks

191596.name: Durch Nacht und Eis zum Nordpol
191596.description:
"Durch Nacht und Eis zum Nordpol. Im Zeppelin mit Dr. Eckener".
One of several roll-and-move games that came out between 1890 and 1910 as the public was enthralled with expeditions to the arctic.

The board features illustrations of the trip north, by ship, dogsled, and skis. The dice rolling journey covers the journey north and the return home.

boardgameintegration: Dale of Merchants
Dale of Merchants
191597.description:
The world has grown smaller. Civilizations around different continents have established independent free trade cities in order to ease trading between distant lands. One of those cities, Yengzuh, is now looking for a new ruler – a new Trade Master.

The post is only open every ten years and the selection of the said individual is no small task. It’s handled by holding a trading competition as it’s in everyone’s best interest to get the best merchant chosen for the job.

All the participating merchants are prestigious, but the competition also tests their ability to deal with unexpected situations. After all, the winner will be responsible of keeping the global prices more fair and stable for years to come.

There are only twelve free trade cities in the world. Yengzuh near Pandala is one of the oldest. The Guild of Extraordinary Traders from Dale promoted the founding of the city after the trade wars in Asia had spread too wide. The city’s harbour has tens of great ships all the time, loading and unloading passengers and cargo.

In Dale of Merchants 2, players take the roles of those participating merchants learning new techniques, trading goods, and managing their stock. The player who first manages to complete their astounding merchant stall wins the game and gets access to the guild!

Dale of Merchants 2 contains six new decks and can be played by itself or combined with the decks from Dale of Merchants. The game includes a new ruleset for four players that introduces team battle! These new rules greatly enhance the four-player experience by adding cooperation between teammates and cutting downtime. These rules can also be used with the original game's six decks.
191597.name: Dale of Merchants 2
boardgameexpansion: Dale of Merchants: Systematic Eurasian Beavers
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 028 – 10 Games for Essen
HLG 5: Patchwork
MN 0149 Small Deck Builders: Valley of the Kings, Dale of Merchants, Xenon Profiteer

191598.name: If on a Winter's Night Four Travellers…
rpg: If On A Winter's Night Four Travellers…
191598.description:
From the rules:
On a cold winter's night, four adventurers huddle around their campfire and ready themselves for a mighty adventure... tomorrow.

In this game you'll never role-play the venture into the Icy Mountain Halls of the Frost Giants to challenge Braggadir, Slayer of Jarmulkost, Reaver of the Frozen Seas, Beloved of Hela; that's because this poem is concerned only with role-playing that winter's night huddled around a flickering campfire.

What hopes burn hot in the hearts of these brave heroes? What cold fears gnaw at their bellies? What tasks occupy frozen fingers and numbed minds on that blasted glacier? What destinies await these adventurers on their return? What cruel wounds received on the bloody ascent need tending?

In this role-playing poem we stay the usual headlong rush into adventure in order to savour the richness of the role-play, for that is what is best in life.

191599.name: Stone and Feather
191599.description:
User Summary:
Stone and Feather is a game poem for three to six players. The players take the roles of birds and describe scenes of a flight in search of something, from the start at their nest to the end of the flight. A feather is passed around to denote the active player, and stones mark the current stage of the narration.

191600.name: Hundra
191600.description:
Description from the game's inlay.

Loki the God of Lies has tricked Jorund, King of the Northern Vikings into entering the forbidden Garden of the Norns. The other Gods, enraged by this insult have imprisoned him in the Kingdom of Lukx. Jorund's Daughter, Hundra has convinced the Gods that it was all loki's fault but she hasn't persuaded them to free her father. But they have given Hundra permission to attempt to rescue him.

This is a difficult task! Hundra has to get into Lukx, free Jorund and find the three sacred jewels before she can get out again.

191601.name: All The Color Has Gone
191601.description:
User Summary:
In this game poem, players share strong memories of their own, but without describing any colour. The players will be able to remember the color of something in the scene or not depending on a coin flip.

191602.name: Yogi's Great Escape
191602.description:
From the back of the game

The fun begins when Yogi and Boo Boo wake up from their long winter's nap and find out that their beloved home, Jellystone Park, must close, and that all of the bears will be sent to a zoo. They cannot bear the thought of being confined, and so Yogi and Boo Boo must make their escape.

191603.name: Treasure Dive
191603.description:
Copied from Rules of Play insert:

The Treasure Dive Game was invented by Ronald C. Ketchum, an internationally certified Scuba Instructor. He created the game as a fun means of review of scuba safety skills for his diving students in Australia. The game has since been revised to include a basic level for children and an advanced level for scuba divers, so that both may play the game at their own level.
INTRODUCTION... Imagine you and your friends each discovering eight pieces of 8 coins on a beach. You know a treasure ship must lay offshore, with a treasure chest containing fabulous wealth. The race is on to be the first one to reach the treasure and claim exclusive salvage rights.
OBJECT...The object of the game is to become the first diver to reach the sunken treasure and return to the surface, thereby staking claim as the Legal Salvor. Descent to the treasure is made by earning various levels of scuba certification. Hazards about, and a knowledge of first aid and diving safety will help you reach the treasure safely.

191605.name: Tales of Lust
191605.description:
User summary:

Sessions of Tales of Lust are shared narrative events where players contribute to a developing narrative. Characters in the game are "monsters", which are defined only with narrative elements. These monsters have various goals, most of them personal, and many of them quite unpalatable. Each player's narrative contributions are open to challenge from other players who may propose alternate developments. A simple dice mechanism is used to resolve these challenges.

191606.name: The Powerpuff Girls: Mojo Jojo A-Go-Go
191606.description:
This is the Powerpuff Girls animated series based video game. It centers around the name of the Power Girls' mission to stop Mojo Jojo and his minions. In the three adventure hero alternately until the game is a transparent or all three of the hero is lost energy. The game developed by Sennari Interactive in 2001 and it is only available for the Game Boy Advance.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_The_Powerpuff_Girls_video_games List of The Powerpuff Girls video games]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

191607.name: Marooned 5
191607.description:
After a boat tour, you crash on an uncharted island where you find five castaways willing to help you. The problem is that others on the island — other players, that is — are also using YOUR people, and they are not being honest about where they are or what they are doing. You might want to get them exiled to insure you fare the best.

In Marooned 5, use the five castaways to help build your raft and get off the island; lounge at the resort sipping drinks with a famous actress; gather and monetize water; or exile all the other players. The player with the most victory points or the last player standing wins.

Players are dealt one worker and one location and use these two cards to create worker placement. You can be honest and safe, or get ahead by claiming the best roles, locations and combos.

191608.name: Powerpuff Girls: Gamesville
191608.description:
http://powerpuffgirls.wikia.com/wiki/The_Powerpuff_Girls:_Gamesville

There are 30 coins in each level. Collecting them in each game will unlock unlimited plays for Arcade mode which also contain slightly different game play with a chance of expanding it with and Time Ring.

191610.name: BMX XXX
191610.description: BMX-based action sports title, it earned most of its notoriety for containing nudity, foul language and adult humor. The game allows the player to create female characters that are fully topless and view live-action video clips of real life strippers, also with bare breasts. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BMX_XXX

191611.name: Queen of Thorns
191611.description:
User summary:

Queen of Thorns describes itself as "a short-form role-playing game for a GM and 1-3 players". The game presents a single scenario to rescue a town maiden from a wicked dungeon. The game primarily is intended to be resolved through narrative processes, though dice rolls are used to track progress. The Game Master maintains two status counters called "The Doom Track" and "The Alarm Track" that determine the course of the scenario.

191612.description:
Skies Above the Reich is a solitaire game depicting a Luftwaffe squadron of Bf109s struggling to deter and destroy the relentless daylight raids over Germany during World War Two. The player's individual aircraft, each represented by a stickered block, must confront the mighty "combat box" formation of the United States Army Air Force, a deadly terrain of B-17 Flying Fortresses.

The game is a broad strokes depiction that presents the arc of the desperate air war. Stretching from late 1942 to early 1945, Skies Above the Reich follows that trajectory in a series of missions strung together to make a campaign. Each mission will take a half hour or more to play, while a campaign can last anywhere from six to sixty missions.
191612.name: Skies Above the Reich

191613.name: Bass Strike
191613.description: Bass Strike is a fishing video game for the PlayStation 2 platform. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bass_Strike

191614.description:
Darkness surrounds the shores of the world and seeps from caves deep beneath the Earth. The maddening howl of eldritch beasts echoes on the night air. Dangerous artifacts from strange eons call to you at all hours of the day. Your quest is nearly complete. So what if bands of enterprising “heroes” have started snooping around. The Old Ones have heard your prayers. Now all you need to do is finish your plans and set them free before these Investigators find you!

Rise of Cthulhu: Dark Secrets is the first expansion to last year’s successful Rise of Cthulhu card game. ROC: DS adds all new Monsters, Artifacts, and Old Ones for players to use in their shadowy path to victory. In addition, the expansion introduces a brand new mechanic: the Investigator. These “would-be heroes” set out to hunt down rumors of your corrupting influence and seek to stop you from awakening the Old Ones. When they appear, they force both you and your opponent to deal with the threat they bring, lest they halt the coming of the age of madness you seek to unleash.

When an Investigator card is drawn, it is placed on the corresponding Location printed in the upper right hand corner of the card. When an Investigator lands on a Location without an Old One, it banishes all the Cultists assembled there, effectively returning all Cultist cards in play to their owner’s hands. Any Monsters or Artifacts that are in play on that Location are removed from the game. The Location then resets to neutral (turns sideways so that it’s not facing either player).

Each Investigator has a number in a red circle in the upper left hand corner of their frame. This represents their resources they bring to bear against both cultist players. Players must play Cultist cards to equal or exceed the resource value listed to remove the Investigator from the Location. Until the Investigator is removed from the Location, players may not play any Cultist cards on any other Location except that one; furthermore, cards played on a Location with an Investigator present on it do not cause the Location to shift to face the player with the highest total value of cards. Once the resource rating is met or exceeded, the Investigator is defeated and removed, at which time the Location would face the player with the highest total Cultists in play there.

Lastly, this expansion adds a new player aide to the card, something the community asked for following the release of the core game.
191614.name: Rise of Cthulhu: Dark Secrets

191615.name: Setting The East Ablaze!
191615.description:
Setting The East Ablaze! contains miniature wargame rules for warfare in Central Europe, Russia, Central Asia, China and elsewhere from the years 1917-1926.

These rules are designed for medium-sized games (c. 60-70 figures per side), but they do work just as well for smaller skirmish-level games, and for larger games of up to 500 figures per side.

Rules use standard six-sided dice. Figures are grouped into units, ranging from 8 (cavalry units) to 20 (irregular mobs) strong. An action card system is then used to play the game, with considerable potential to customize the card deck depending on the game you wish to play.

Appendices provide further information on basic points value of units, tanks and armored cars, optional rules, fire and bomb templates, and army morale.

191616.name: Her Son
191616.description:
User summary:

The game uses a stripped deck of playing cards that is allocated along a certain formula; all cards have certain meanings, but some cards are more significant than others. Play also involves "Departure Cards" which are print-cut-and-play components of the rules, as well as a map. Play involves a rather sophisticated series of card hands and token movements.

191617.name: In Exile
191617.description:
User summary:

In Exile is atypical for a role-playing game inasmuch as the Game Master acts as a character (the "Queen in Chains") with a central role in the narrative structure. While mechanically this role functions somewhat like a traditional role-playing setup, the conceptual inclusion of the Game Master is a compelling change.

The players in turn attempt to execute actions in behalf of the Queen in Chains. While primarily narrative, the game uses a simple dice mechanism to select from narrative options that have a potentially notable impact on the game.

191618.name: The Strongest Link
191618.description:
User summary:

In The Strongest Link each player controls a character that has a lust (goal); there is no game master. Characters attempt to impress other characters that their own lust is more important than any other. In a series of rounds, characters secretly pass distinctive tokens to identify which other character wins their support. Ultimately, one character triumphs and gains the reluctant support of the remainder of the group.

boardgameintegration: Ophidian 2350
Ophidian 2360: Survival of the Fittest – Mental Block vs. Warrior's Resolve
Ophidian 2360: Survival of the Fittest – War Machine vs. Bio-Hazard
Ophidian 2350
Ophidian 2360: Survival of the Fittest – Mental Block vs. Warrior's Resolve
Ophidian 2360: Survival of the Fittest – War Machine vs. Bio-Hazard
191619.description:
Ophidian 2360: Survival of the Fittest is a non-collectible expansion to the Ophidian 2350 arena combat game as well as a standalone game that pits futuristic gladiators against each other using unique and thematic mechanisms.

In the game, each player brings a team of up to four gladiators to the table, along with a customized deck that's driven by the selected gladiators. Gameplay revolves around a momentum-based system that allows the player with the momentum to continue to take actions until they lose momentum, at which point their opponent picks up and continues.

Players use resources to supply their gladiators with equipment and minions (support characters). The crowd gets involved through cheer and also provides an alternate victory condition. Win the crowd, and you win the game!

Mix and match cards from any Ophidian 2360: Survival of the Fittest decks:

Ophidian 2360: Survival of the Fittest – Mental Block vs. Warrior's Resolve
Ophidian 2360: Survival of the Fittest – War Machine vs. Bio-Hazard
Ophidian 2360: Survival of the Fittest – The Art of War vs. Otherworld Allies




Playing with four players will require a total of four playable decks.

Many character options, 4 different win conditions, and a large number of in-game choices/options makes this a truly unique and engaging game!
191619.name: Ophidian 2360: Survival of the Fittest – The Art of War vs. Otherworld Allies

191620.name: Brick & Mortar: Last of the Independents
rpg: Brick & Mortar: Last of the Independents
191620.description:
User summary:

Brick & Mortar: Last of the Independents presents four pre-generated characters (two of which are required in every game; two of which are optional) and the framework of a scenario, though the details of the scenario are determined by the players. The game does not use a game master. Play proceeds in a formalized manner with each character having distinct skills, goals, and tendencies. While much of the game is pre-determined by the rules, the players also can exercise substantive input.

191621.name: Queens of Time and Space
191621.description:
User summary:

Queens of Time and Space utilizes a map (included as a print-and-play component in the rules) that provides several aspects of play more usually found in board games. Players utilize pre-generated characters, called Queens, that randomly are distributed. While each Queen has a list of core Attributes, each also is unique.

191622.name: Homage to Ninshubar
191622.description:
User summary:

Characters have Attributes, including: Chains, Beauty, Forbearance, and Pain. Additionally, characters have Traits that include Favor, Promises, and Secrets, that vary during play. All characters have a role in a difficult, terrible household, where they have chains that tie themselves to the master.

191623.name: All the King's Men (2011)
191623.description:
From the introduction:

The year is 1192. The Third Crusade is drawing to a close, many soldiers are returning home after years of warfare. Richard Lionheart, absentee King of England, has disappeared.

England has suffered for years under the burden of the Third Crusade. Now it suffers again under the rule of King John. Tax collectors travel the countryside, hunting down every last farthing owed to the King. Knights hold the border lands through a mix of fear and mercenaries.

All of this greets you as you are discharged from the boats, members of an army that no longer needs you. Unable to return to society after what you have seen and done, you were looking towards life as a bandit or mercenary.

Thankfully, your life is destined for something more. You have been approached by those loyal to the King and offered a commission. You will go forth and remove those who act with treason in their hearts.

You are now one of the King's Men.

191624.description:
In Bear Valley, you must be the first to survive the treacherous wilderness and escape to the safety of the camp at the end of the valley. Players start as 2-6 campers along the Bear River and must navigate the wilderness, avoiding bears and trying to not get lost.

The map of trails and challenges is built by the players as they explore the wilderness. These wilderness cards feature beautifully illustrated realistic art and have between three and six exit points along with a variety of features, both man-made and natural in origin. No two games will ever play the same.

Gameplay is structured around a clever movement mechanism in which the first player moves one card, the second player moves up to two cards, the third player three, and so on. Each of the six player characters has both advantages and disadvantages that can be used across a variety of play options — short or long play, regular or advanced.

Dive into caves, row canoes, cross bridges, climb mountains, and cut through treacherous underbrush as you stop at nothing — except bears — to be the first to reach base camp. Can you survive and escape Bear Valley?
191624.name: Bear Valley
boardgamepodcastepisode: Dice Tower Con - Episode 041
Episode 22 - Cody Miller Interview
Episode 76- The Networks and Origins 2016
RDTN Episode 97: Reviews of Tyrants of the Underdark, Simurgh, Mystic Vale, My Village, Tides of Madness and Others
The Long View - Quick Looks #17
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 67!!!
What Did You Play this Week Podcast Thing Week 79

191625.name: Spade vs. Indy
191625.description:
User summary:

Spade vs. Indy uses two stripped packs of playing cards; one is used during character generation, another is used for action resolution. The game includes print-and-play character sheets that facilitate an atypical fusion of card play and role-playing.

191626.name: Ghost Runner: The 9th Layer
191626.description:
From the introduction:

Ghost Runners is a game set in the not so distant future, at the end of the 21st century. The year is 2099. After WWIII ended in a coalition of Asian nations, led by China and Japan, the world has been forever changed. Massive government sponsored corporations rule the world. Technology has advanced in leaps and bounds. The wait for the flying car has finally come to an end, but information control is more potent than ever. However, the world isn’t exactly the highly advanced future that everyone was hoping for when the new millennium rolled around about 100 years ago. The Information Control Act of 2045 ended the war and put a choke hold on the internet. Access to information, by the people at least, is highly restricted. However, large corporations have achieved unimaginable technological gains.

191627.name: Ritual Magic Expanded for 5th Edition Fantasy
191627.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ritual magic is interesting and accessible even to non-spellcasters, but as a concept, it is currently underdeveloped. There are too few ritual spells.
