By expanding this concept, there can be many opportunities to provide players and game masters with more spellcasting utility, and also to weave magic into your story in a way that is holistic and does not imbalance your campaign. This product contains many new rituals, as well as guidelines for the use of rituals by non-casters, rewarding players with ritual knowledge, and providing a deeper subtext for magic within your campaign setting.

This product line brings you an assortment of ideas, homebrew rules, and various options from the talented pool of writers at Fat Goblin Games for use with the world’s oldest role playing game. These short and low-priced products are perfect for Game Masters and Players who want to integrate unique new options to their games.

191628.name: Goblin Lake (Deluxe)
191628.description:
From publisher blurb:

Wearing only a scaly lizard-skin loincloth, you easily slide through a crevice leading to the legendary subterranean caverns of the goblins. With a final grunt, you wade through icy water and cross the slimy rocks that block your way into the caves.

An ignominious death or fabulous wealth, enslavement or power beyond your imagination, what will you find when you adventure into Goblin Lake? One thing is certain: while there is life, there is hope!

Written by T&T creator Ken St Andre and will all-new art by Simon Trantor, Goblin Lake has been expanded and updated for use with Deluxe Tunnels and Trolls. You should play a goblin no higher than 3rd level, but you may also adventure with a dwarf, hobb, or even a small human. All classes of characters may play, but no magic will work in the vicinity of Goblin Lake.

This is a solitaire adventure for Deluxe Tunnels & Trolls.

191629.name: The Talisman of Moloch
191629.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mini Quests by Survive RPG offer compelling 2-6 page adventures that are great for a one-off session, convention play or for use as a side quest to your campaign. Mini-Quests is designed for any D20 fantasy system.

In THE TALISMAN OF MOLOCH the characters must escort a priestess of light as she returns the dreaded Talisman to the tomb of its master. If Moloch should rise the kingdom will fall under his curse of undeath. Will the characters surive?

191630.name: 101 Urban Spells
191630.description:
From publisher blurb:

Don’t Let the City Unsettle You!

Whether in a small town or a sprawling metropolis, characters somehow always find trouble in a city. 101 Urban Spells offers spellcasters new options for navigating, surviving and enjoying settlements near and far.

From the magnificent estates of the very rich to the festering piles of filth in the back alleys, adventurers find ways to take advantage of their surroundings. Looking for great bargains at the bazaar? Want to summon some gremlins to pester an enemy? Need to disperse a gathering mob? Look no further.

191631.name: Nerf Rebelle Disc Target Game
191631.description:
The Nerf Rebelle Disc Target Game was released as a toy included in McDonald's Happy Meals. It is part of the Nerf Rebelle line, designed to appeal primarily to girls.

This game has a two-sided board and can be played in two ways. One side of the board is a combination of a dexterity game and tic-tac-toe. The board is laid out on the floor or a table and players take turns throwing plastic discs, trying to land them in one of the spaces on the 3x3 grid. Players may of course knock other players' discs off the board. Like tic-tac-toe, the first player to get three discs in a row wins.

The other side of the board is a target game. Players take turns throwing their discs at the board, trying to land them in scoring circles. Smaller circles have higher point values. After each player has thrown all his or her discs, the highest total score wins.

Because the rules are minimal (and conveyed only with pictures), player will have to create house rules to answer lots of questions, such as whether players may pick up and rethrow discs if no one get three in a row in the tic-tac-toe version and how much of a disc must be inside a scoring circle to score points in the target game.

191632.name: Curse of Cragbridge (DCC)
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
191632.description:
From publisher blurb:

Prison of Spirits Betrayed!

For five hundred years, Cragbridge has stood abandoned and cursed. Within lurk the haunts and spirits of those that served Lord and Lady Etheril. Some of these ghosts inhabit the forms of strange insectile humanoids while others guard tombs deep beneath the shattered bridge tower.

Recently, the good knight Sir Dougal Skavok disappeared in the ruin, and when a search party returned, they twoo were missing a few members. But they carried strange treasures found there: coins marked with a double-headed raven, gemstones of great value and other ornate and gilded items.They also spoke of the evils that lurked there, cursed forever by the vengeful Lady Etheril.

The Curse of Cragbridge is a DCC RPG Adventure for character levels 0-2.

191633.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 5, Issue 2 - Wicked Jenny)
191633.description:
From publisher blurb:

Packed full of great superhero fun, each issue will offer a short adventure, an NPC, or some game mechanics for the Heroes Wear Mask system. While compatible with the HWM system, you can always use the information presented in each issue for other superhero games—just monkey around with the stats and mechanics to fit the system you are using.

A powerful witch from the past threatens the heroes with magic and curses.

191634.name: Infinite Weapons 4
191634.description:
From publisher blurb:

What sci-fi universe is complete without a sourcebook of cool toys to play with? Thus begins a new, fully detailed series of Gear Books for the Fringe setting. Inside this book, you will find all kinds of awesome weapons to use in your games. Go buy all the stuff, strap them on, and conquer the universe.

Compatible with Infinite Futures 2.0 and other science fiction realms.

191635.description:
Description from the publisher:

The last war of the Enlightenment broke out in July 1778, following the death of the Elector of Bavaria. Austrian Emperor Joseph II sought Bavaria for himself; Prussian King Frederick II wished to block this acquisition. Their conflict became known as the War of the Bavarian Succession or, more colorfully, as the Potato War. Armies of both sides marched about Bohemia, scouring the landscape for food (potatoes in particular) while the diplomats hashed out a solution.

Soldier Kings: The Potato War brings this worldwide interlocking conflict to Soldier Kings, as Britain struggles with a growing insurgency in her American colonies, France fans those flames and supports Austria, Prussia seeks to block the annexation of Bavaria and Russia supports Prussia. Happy Austria has once again married her way to more territory, but still has to take possession.

The Potato War is a 64-page book supplement for Soldier Kings, a multiplayer game of the Seven Years' War. In addition to the new Potato War scenario and its pieces, there are new pieces (with optional rules for their use) for the Seven Years' War scenarios of Soldier Kings, plus some additional options.
191635.name: Soldier Kings: The Potato War

191636.description:
Description from the publisher:

Napoleon's 1803 coronation as Emperor of the French touched off a worldwide series of wars, that lasted until his second and final exile in 1815. Soldier Emperor lets you play out the campaigns in Europe, while Indian Empires covers those in, you guessed it, India.

Soldier Emperor: Dreams of Empire is a 64-page book that brings those two games together, with a linking map covering the Persian Empire and the Central Asian khanates of Khiva, Kokand and Bokhara, plus some pieces of Afghanistan and other regions and new pieces to represent the armies and leaders of these distant lands.

The book also includes additional scenarios for each game. For Soldier Emperor, it's the war that would have broken out in 1815 had Napoleon not returned from Elba to re-unite his quarreling enemies. For Indian Empires, there's the 1760 Afghan-Maratha War, which resulted in the massive Battle of Panipat, and the Seven Years' War in India featuring the conquests of Robert Clive.

And there are more new variants for both Soldier Emperor and Indian Empires, like National Aspirations to give each power their own special victory conditions and special abilities for each major power. These make every country different to play, and not just because of their geographical position. There are new Imperial Power rules, and a whole assortment of additional special rules just because they make the games even more fun to play.
191636.name: Soldier Emperor: Dreams of Empire

191637.name: Hero Flix
191637.description:
In Hero Flix, you take on the role of a movie director. Your task is to complete a production and earn Production Points toward a winning score of 10 points. More complex productions have a higher Production Point value but also take longer to complete.

While working towards Completing a Production, there are opportunities to increase the value of your production or impact the production of other players. Some examples include:


Joining in their success (joining them as a Co-Producer),
Lowering the Production Point value (through a Smear Campaign), or
Preventing them from Completing the Production this turn (via an Injunction).


Hero Flix enables you to change the level of interaction by removing some cards from the game. We break these styles into three “Budget Levels”:


"B Movie" - there is a low chance of influencing another player,
"Major Motion Picture" - you have some chance for influencing another player, and
"Summer Blockbuster" - another player production will get influenced unless you are doing it wrong. This is how the game was designed to be played.

191639.name: Invasion Strike
191639.description:
You can play the same great retro-arcade space shooter action from Invasion Strike for free! Jump in your space ship. You’ll be instantly at one with the controls. Dodge enemies and unleash your fury with your auto-fire laser cannons. Defend your world from the incoming invasion of wave after wave of enemies. Shields up!


Super easy to learn – anyone can play!
Retro game play with great 3d visuals
Simple tilt controls to steer your ship
Auto-fire guns for killer action!
Awesome explosions!
Tons of power ups!
iPhone 5 and 5th generation iPod touch support!
Play on your iCade devices!


Source: The Developer Website.

191640.name: Stranded!
rpgseries: Choose Your Own Adventure for Younger Readers
191640.description:
YOU ARE STRANDED ON A DESERT ISLAND!
You're on an ocean liner crossing the Pacific when a gigantic wave knocks you overboard.After several hours floating on a wooden crate, you land on the shores of a tropical island. You have no way to get home! You could explore the island, but you can't be sure what you will find. Perhaps you should stay where you are and hope to signal a passing ship.

If you decide to stay where you are, turn to page 45. If you decide to go exploring, turn to page 36. But be careful! The island seems deserted, but there could be many dangers waiting for you!

On the tropical island, you might come face-to-face with a roaring gorilla. Or you might find people there who will help you find a way home! What happens next while you are stranded depends on the choice you make. Some of your adventures will be scary, some will be exciting - but all of them will be fun!

(back of book)

191641.description:
The Roman Empire ruled the civilized world with an iron fist, seemingly all-powerful and limitless — yet the power of Rome is secured not by its mighty legions, but by small bands of warriors and agents fighting a secret war. Tasked by the Emperor to explore ancient temples, forgotten labyrinths, and beast-haunted caverns, they seek out artifacts hidden by the gods themselves, hunt creatures of myth, and face enemies that would use dark magic against the empire.

Broken Legions: Fantasy Skirmish Wargames in the Roman Empire is a set of fantasy skirmish rules for a war unknown to history, fought in the shadows of the Roman Empire. Various factions recruit small warbands to fight in tight, scenario-driven battles that could secure the mystical power to defend — or crush — Rome. A points system allows factions to easily build a warband, and mercenaries and free agents may also be hired to bolster a force. Heroes and leaders may possess a range of skills, traits, and magical abilities, but a henchman's blade can be just as sharp, and a campaign can see even the lowliest henchman become a hero of renown.
191641.name: Broken Legions: Fantasy Skirmish Wargames in the Roman Empire
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Game Pit Podcast: Episode 61 - 2016 Treasure Hunt Part 1

191642.description:
Poseidon's Warriors: Classical Naval Warfare 480-31 BC is a set of war gaming rules for large-scale naval actions between fleets of classical galleys from the Greek and Persian clash at the battle of Salamis to the battle of Actium that decided the fate of Rome. With so many of these battles taking place around islands or in narrow channels and shallow waters, sneaky tactics and cunning maneuvers are a hallmark of warfare of this era, and the rules use an integrated turn system to allow a commander to position ships to go in and ram without being rammed in return, or to employ feints and traps to tempt the enemy out of position and leave his ships vulnerable to a follow-up strike.

With data for ships throughout the period, rules for famous admirals, historical scenarios, a campaign system and a brief historical summary for those who wish to refresh their memory of the era, Poseidon's Warriors offers everything players need to bring to the tabletop the battles and campaigns of the first great age of naval warfare.
191642.name: Poseidon's Warriors: Classical Naval Warfare 480-31 BC

191643.name: Identity Poems
191643.description:
User Summary:
A series of five Role-Playing Poems (or sketches thereof) dealing with players' identities, published by Matthijs Holter on his Nørwegian Style blog.

191644.name: Feats of Lust
191644.description:
From publisher blurb:

The More Feats! PDFs introduce a single page of themed feats for use with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. Every PDF contains a 2.5 pages of high quality content (no fluff or filler)!
This installment of the More Feats! product line introduces a new kind of feat: the sin feat. Sin feats are designed to represent a character’s vices and moral failings, though they are by no means restricted to evil or non-good characters. Though a few sin feats are supernatural in nature, and some even grant bonuses of the profane type, characters of any faith or alignment may wrestle with sinful vices – grappling with and overcoming such a moral complication often serves to highlight a character’s heroism.

Feats of Lust includes twelve new feats for highlighting the sin of Lust: Carnal Satisfaction, Damnable Desires, Distract, Expressions of Lust, Feigh Innocence, Intoxicating Presence,Lustful Spell, Scandolous Display, Shameless Display,Unadulterated Lust, Wanton Will, and Wriggling Wrestler.

191645.name: The Summoning Stones
191645.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dr. Mae Wylde and her team ended an occult breach on the tiny island of Aunu’u in American Samoa three weeks ago. Dr. Wylde and her team returned safely from the Pacific Islands with the mysterious summoning stones believed to cause the breach. . .but the team has gone dark. They last checked in from Dr. Wylde’s home in Upper Peninsula Michigan.

As auxiliaries for Intervention Incorporated, your job is simple: Find the team. Assess the threat. End it.

The Summoning Stones is a briefing book for a Power Level 4 operation using Modernity (Fate Edition) and the core Modernity text is required to fully utilize The Summoning Stones. It is fully compatible with other Fate Core products. All minor variations are documented in the core Modernity book.

191646.name: Tombs of the Desolation
191646.description:
From publisher blurb:

THE DREAD OF THIS DESOLATION

The Desolation stretches beyond the Northern Reach, a blighted place, poisoned by dark magic and infested with undead. Fools and heroes alike test their mettle against the dangers this land poses, forcing them to contend with blood-thirsty vampires or dust storms of apocalyptic proportions. This sourcebook reveals one of the most dangerous places in the lands of Rûl, providing new options for players and Game Masters alike, such as:

Revenant, Salamander, and Vampire ancestries
New paths including the Prince of Darkness and Slayer of the Dead
The Blood tradition and new spells for existing traditions
Details about the Desolation and surrounding lands
New relics and creatures like the Cauldron of Death and the Desiccated One
A new adventure!




Tombs of the Desolation reveals more details about the world of the Demon Lord, giving you all the tools you need to tell stories set in a desert wasteland!

191647.name: 50 Shades of Bad Sex
191647.description:
User Summary:
This is a game poem for badly narrating sex scenes, as far too often seen in fiction. The players make themselves uncomfortable, and then describe the scene sentence-by-sentence using strongly and awkwardly connotated words on cards drawn.

191648.name: Synthetic Swordsmen of the Purple Planet
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
191648.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Level 5 Adventure on The Purple Planet for DCC RPG

When even the native lifeforms of the Purple Planet begin to wither and die under the weirdling sun’s punishing rays, you and your party of interplanetary freebooters quickly conclude that something is going wrong with the very sky above your heads. What ancient mysteries lie in wait for you at the planet’s northern pole, as you explore the timeworn and failing biosphere plant found sprawling there amongst the ice peaks? Will you save your harsh but adopted home, or hasten its eventual doom?

This adventure features new background material that expands the campaign setting, including a new House of Ascended Masters, new weapons and ancient technology to plunder, and a surprising new species of Kith warriors.

191649.name: The Shadow Monk (Class Archetype)
191649.description:
From publisher blurb:

Not all monks follow the path of peace and self-enlightenment. The Shadow Monk follows a much darker path, hidden in the shadows. This archetype includes an archetype version for both the traditional monk and the Unchained Monk as found in Pathfinder Unchained.

191650.name: Punched!
191650.description:
The years’ 1965 and you’ve just gotten a job in one of those brand new “Data Centers”. Your job is to feed endless piles of punch cards into different computers and tally the results. Problem is, you kinda all overstated your experience with these machines and you don’t really know what you’re doing.
You and your colleagues will feed the computers with punch cards and hope that everything goes well and that no computers jam and overheat!
Who knows, maybe you’ll get to be the supervisor!

Gameplay:

Players get number cards.
With these cards, they need to combine these to form equations (addition, subtractions, divisions) or to form whole numbers.

Then they get to enter these values in one of the computers, in various bases (base 2, base 3, prime numbers, tec...)

For each values that match. the player puts one of his cubes in the column, to gain majority and points.

The player with the most points wins and becomes the supervisor.

191651.name: Metacide
191651.description:
From publisher blurb:

He is on a mission to end all superhumans… Metacide!

A Power Level 9 Rogue, Metacide (who calls himself “The Purifier”) is a fanatic on a mission of death. He is an iconic character in the Beacon City universe, but can be dropped into any campaign with very little alteration.

Metacide's file is designated "Orange" to indicate his lack of metahuman super-powers, his mission bolstered by anti-metahuman weaponry and training. He’s bigoted and violent, driven to hunt down and destroy anyone with super-normal abilities, regardless of whether they pose any actual threat to humanity. He is often employed by masterminds or organizations which share his zeal for destruction, or simply want to use him as a hindrance for heroes getting in their way. He may also simply target a hero for using powers in public, or for supporting the “Metahuman Agenda.” A hero who is struggling with a sense of identity in a world that is torn apart by the existence of metahumans will certainly come into conflict with Metacide sooner or later, as he represents a very punch-able incarnation of bigotry. Metacide is ready to deploy against such heroes at a moment’s notice with his P.A.S.S. system.

191652.name: Prisons of the Demigods Adventure I: The Curse of Cragbridge
191652.description:
From publisher blurb:

Prison of Spirits Betrayed!

A Labyrinth Lord compatible Adventure for Characters level 1-3.

For five hundred years, Cragbridge has stood abandoned and cursed. Within lurk the haunts and spirits of those that served Lord and Lady Etheril. Some of these ghosts inhabit the forms of strange insect creatures, while others guard tombs deep beneath the shattered bridge tower.

Recently, the good knight Sir Dougal Skavok disappeared in the ruins, and when the search party returned, they too were missing a few members. But, they carried strange treasures found there: coins marked with a double-headed raven, gemstones of great value, and other ornate and gilded items. They also spoke of the curses and haunts that lurk under the ruins of Cragbridge!

Featuring all original monsters, two unique magic items and a hell of a lot of fun.

191653.name: Vaagwol
191653.description:
From publisher blurb:

The tall, dreary walls of Vaagwol nestle on the marshy edge of the Twyll River delta. Barely seen through the ever-present fog, the Hungry Dead continually claw at the village's stout stones; scratching and moaning a constant reminder to those trapped inside of the doom lingering outside their walls. Further walls divide the village inside to prevent the spread of the Craving. The residents scurry through narrow lanes, afraid to venture too close to fellow citizens, lest they be infected with the plague that turns them into the same shambling monsters that threaten from without.

191654.name: A Pebble
191654.description:
User summary:
“A Pebble” is an emotional role-playing poem about the topic of abortion. Two players play out a serious conversation about the topic, while the other players present possible futures of the unborn child.

191655.name: Mortal Intrusion
rpg: Spooks! Welcome to the Great Beyond
191655.description:
From publisher blurb:

For thousands of years the dead have invaded the living, haunting our towns and stalking our streets. Now, it's our turn. The veil has been torn and the living have found the methods to cross into the Hereafter. Play as the blessed, exemplars, faekin, magi, psychics and were creatures. Encounter several secret organizations or even join them on their mission to expand their influence across the globe and into the Great Beyond. Hunt monsters, uncover mysteries, thwart the advance of evil undead. But remember, death comes for us all and once your character falls to the darkness they will emerge in the Great Beyond themselves able to continue their adventures in the afterlife or find a way to return to the Land of the Living to take care of their unfinished business.

191657.description:
In Dr. Gomb (a.k.a., Dr. Button), everyone collects buttons. Players can collect any number from 1-5, but only one card's color can be different from the others. This card is called the "odd one out". Players can start any number of sequences, but they can have only one sequence of each color, so the maximum number of sequences is five. Any number can occur only once in a sequence and its mandatory to have one and only one "odd one out" card in the sequence.

The goal is to have the most points by the end of the game.
191657.name: Dr. Gomb

191658.name: Vacant Ritual Assembly (Issue 5 - Winter 2015)
191658.description:
From publisher blurb:

Issue #5 Includes:

New Artwork from Jeremy Duncan, Aaron Hamric, Olli Hihnala, Sean Poppe, and Xolis
Koster's Knob: A ready-to-use halfling village by Judd Karlman.
Weedwise Wizarding: An accounting of the Knob's more popular strains of pipe weed. New "Pipe Arts" skill.
The Ritualist: A new LotFP character class framework by Kathryn Richards.
Unholy Inversion of Hope: A grimdark, psuedo-Catholic religion from my campaign.
The Sineater Wolves: A heretical order of lycanthropic monks. Rules for lycanthropy.
On The Raggi: An interview with James Raggi IV, author of Lamentations of the Flame Princess.

191659.name: Symbaroum Adventure Pack 1
191659.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Symbaroum - Adventure Pack I consists of two small adventure landscapes and a text presenting guidelines for how to handle and/or design expeditions into the forest of Davokar. Together with the tutorial adventure featured in the Symbaroum Core Rulebook, this material is perfect for starting up your adventures in Ambria and Davokar – it will give the Game Master and players a feel for the game world and also force the player characters to face a wide variety of different challenges.

The first text, called Treasure Hunts in Davokar, can be used as a randomizer or as inspiration when preparing for adventures in the forest. Aside from rules regarding preparations and excavations, it contains tables with random encounters, different kinds of treasures (from debris to mystical artifacts) and for determining what kind of ruins are found in the wilds.

The adventure landscapes that follow are entitled The Curse of the River Goddess and Blight Night. In their original form they should take about one game session to finish, but both can be developed into longer adventures if the Game Master wishes. In any case, they should provide material for many hours of intense and entertaining gaming around the table

191660.name: Age of Summoners
boardgamepublisher: Chicken Dice Games (チキンダイスゲームズ)
191660.description:
User summary:
エイジオブサモナー ～大召喚時代～ (Age of Summoner Dai Shoukan Jidai) Age of Summoners is a card game of elemental conjuration. As Summoners, players gain victory points by summoning their elementals.

In this game, each card has three usages: an elemental to be summoned, power source to summon an elemental, and an action number to play a specific action.

Your action is determined by the total action number of two cards, the one from yours and the other from one of your opponents, so the opponent can limit your available actions to some extent. You should plan your moves considering your hand and the card the opponent sent to you.

Who will be the second coming of King Solomon by summoning many elementals?

The artwork for this game was taken from copyright free images.

Publisher's summary:
エイジオブサモナーは、「精霊の召喚」をテーマにしたカードゲームです。
プレイヤーは召喚師として様々なカード（＝精霊）を登場させ、得点を稼ぎます。
このゲームでは、召喚のためのコストも、行動を起こすための力も、全ては手札に集約されています。
１枚のカードに、アクション、魔力、精霊と３通りの顔が存在するのです。
さらに、アクションは自分ひとりで完結する訳ではありません。
他プレイヤーから送られたカードと自らのカード、２枚の組み合わせをよく考え、効率の良い行動を設計してください。
数多くの妖魔をあやつり、ソロモン王の再来となるのは一体誰でしょうか？"

191661.name: 13 Shades of Darkness
191661.description:
From publisher blurb:

Like most people, you've probably asked yourself "How can I get my hands on more nightmarish supernatural evil?" Well look no further! Thirteen Shades of Darkness contains M&M Superlink stats and background information for thirteen occult supervillains, ranging in power from minor annoyances to dark and malignant gods.

Each of our thirteen villains offers a slightly different take on the genre; a shade of darkness all its own. They range in tone from lighthearted to unspeakable (and a few of them are both). Some are traditional supervillains whose powers derive from the occult--thieves, killers and murderous megalomaniacs who use the dark arts to pursue traditional supervillain goals, while some are much worse things.

Each comes with at least two adventure scenarios, for thirty adventures in total. All the blood-curdling horror you could possibly want, and perhaps just a little bit more!

191662.name: A Roleplaying Poem about Logocentrism
191662.description:
Abridged from the original post:
This one is about stories where conflicts aren't resolved, where goals aren't achieved, where life is meaningless and where mysteries stay mysteries. Think of the briefcase in Pulp Fiction, or the truth of what happened in Run Lola Run.

I started thinking about it when I realized how logocentric most roleplaying is. So often it's about achievement, discovery, resolution, and meaning. I started to wonder what a game would look like if it weren't about those things. This is a primitive version, but, for me, somewhat of a revelation.

191663.name: 13 Shades of Darkness 2.0
191663.description:
From publisher blurb:

At last available for M&M 2nd Edition!

Thirteen Shades of Darkness contains 2nd Edition M&M stats and background information on 13 supernatural supervillains. Each villain is a slightly different "take" on the genre, a particular shade of darkness. Some are traditional super-criminals who happen to derive their powers from magic, while some are much stranger and pursue less familiar goals. Some are lighthearted, some are mind-bogglingly horrible. Some are both! Every conceivable level of power and lethality is represented, from minor annoyances to dark and malignant gods. Each comes with at least two adventure scenarios, for thirty adventures in total.

All the blood-curdling horror you could possibly want, and perhaps just a little bit more!

191664.name: Saints and Sinners: The Gallery of Polish Kings
191664.description:
Saints and Sinners: The Gallery of Polish Kings is a two-player card game in which the players impersonate the powers of good and evil struggling for the souls of Polish monarchs. The aim of the game is to make three characters either "saint" or "damned" by means of playing sin and virtue cards, which are specific for each faction. The game includes sixteen double-sided monarch cards — twelve of them are always in play — that possess different special abilities depending on whether the card has the good or evil side up, and multiple copies of seven deadly sins and seven heavenly virtues cards.

The artwork is inspired by a series of paintings by Jan Matejko, a famous Polish painter, under the name "The Gallery of Polish Kings and Dukes" (created 1890–1892).

191665.name: Age of Revive
boardgamepublisher: Chicken Dice Games (チキンダイスゲームズ)
191665.description:
User summary:
エイジ・オブ・リバイブ (Age of Revive) is a construction game in which players try to reconstruct and revive a city devastated by a long war.

Initially, the city is full of rubble. You clear and reuse it into significant buildings. Constructed buildings form a ring-shaped world. Players move along the ring and collect resources for their next building.

The winner is the player who has collected most victory points by constructing glorious buildings and receiving King's favor.

The artwork for this game uses copyright free images.

Publisher's summary:
Age of Reviveは、復興と再生をテーマにした建築ゲームです。
舞台は長く続いた戦乱から解放された大都市です。
はじめはいたる所ガレキの山が重なるのみですが、これを撤去、再利用して立派な建築物に変えてゆきます。
建築された施設は円環状の世界を作り、プレイヤーはその上を転々と移動しながら、次の建築のための資源を集めるのです。
壮麗な建物と、王の支持をもっとも積み上げた人物が、勝者に選ばれます。

191666.name: West Side Horror
191666.description:
User summary:

West Side Horror (alternately, West Side Horrors) presents scenarios of people living in less-than-ideal situations who are looking for a way out. Everyone is miserable and all wish for an escape. The game uses an interesting bidding process, coupled with dice, to resolve narrative disputes.

191667.name: Pengin Jujiryou
boardgamepublisher: Chicken Dice Games (チキンダイスゲームズ)
191667.description:
User summary:
ペンギン十字稜 (Pengin Jujiryou) means "Penguin Pyramidion" in English.

One day, a Penguin suddenly claimed that he is the "Emperor" of all the Penguins. The entire Penguin nation, which once lived peacefully, became strained and is currently in the midst of struggle. Each species has to flourish by increasing their population and producing offspring. Weak species will become extinct naturally, but even strong species may be made extinct by misfortune. Only one species may survive in the end!

Players roll total of 55 dice, and build a five-tier pyramid. You have to name a species which will be the summit of the pyramid. Which species will win the generations-long survival game?

The artwork for this game uses copyright free images.

Publisher's summary:
ある日突然、一匹のペンギンが『帝王』であると名乗りを上げました。
平和な群れに緊張が走ります。いままさにペンギン達は、競争の真っただ中です。兄弟を増やして繁栄し、後の世代に子孫を残さねばなりません。 弱い遺伝子は淘汰され、強い遺伝子も運が悪ければ絶えてしまいます。
最終的に生き残るのはたった一種類のみです！
プレイヤーは55個のダイスを積み上げてピラミッドを作ります。そのてっぺんに座ることになるペンギンを推理せねばなりません。
世代を超えて繰り広げられる、サバイバルゲームに勝利するのはどの種族でしょうか？

191668.name: Falls the Divide
191668.description:
From publisher blurb:

Built high on cliffs overlooking the confluence of two rivers, Gurthap Keep was a bastion of strength and a haven for the Cult of the Red God. Here, priests of old sacrificed over the tomb of long dead Kha M Thir, honoring him for his long service to the Red God.

They added bastions to the keep, walls, temple and barracks. From there they terrorized the surrounding country, raiding the villages of Alice, Greenbriar and Ends Meet until at last the rangers gathered against the Cult and overthrew it. They drove them from their walls and those they did not slay, fled into the Darkenfold to the south.

The castle has sat thus ever since, a grim testament to the gods of the old world. The forest has consumed it and only the memories of men keep it alive. But beyond its abandoned walls lie the shadows of yesteryear. For the tomb of Kah M Thir was never found and the secrets of the priests of the Red God never fully revealed.

This adventure is a set piece adventure, taking place entirely in and around the Falls. The adventure can pick up after C4 Harvest of Oaths, however it is not necessary to play that adventure in order to enjoy Falls the Divide. Other adventures may enhance play but are not necessary: C1 Mortality of Green, C2 Shades of Mist and C3 Upon the Powder River.

191669.name: Three Old Men
191669.description:
From the Game's Introduction:
This game requires exactly three players. The three players will play the parts of three old men in a retirement community: Charles, Peter, and Michael. Each of these three men wish each the others dead.

User Summary:
The characters are fixed: three old men that have known each other for years. The game consists of the men conversing and accusing each other. This may escalate, potentially even leading up to one man killing another. The game ends when either only one is left alive, or the men back down and choose to maintain the uneasy status quo.

191670.name: Harvest of Oaths
191670.description:
From publisher blurb:

The River Basin lies between the Spine Ridge to the north, and the Cherry Hills in the south. It holds the meandering Mistbane River, the life blood of the ancient and dreaded wood, the Darkenfold. Here trails switch back on one the other through a country haunted by small dragons, wild eschl and will o wisps.

Travel here is difficult and dangerous.

Follow the trail into the Bolan Drops and climb the high country overlooking the Wingnut Bottoms, travel onto the Lake of Nunt, to the banks of the Watchita River, all in the tracks of an Oath that passed through the words many years ago.

Harvest of Oaths is a series of encounters that can be played together as a loosely linked story for an overland campaign, or broken into pieces and played separately. The adventures are designed for mid-level characters, but are fairly easy to scale for high and low level characters.

Plunge once more into the Darkenfold and explore the haunts of the River Basin Country.

191671.name: Codex of Aihrde Expansion: The Darkenfold
191671.description:
From publisher blurb:

In days long past, the Ethvold’s roots grew deep and her boughs spread, or so men claimed, from the setting to the rising sun. Peopled by beasts of wild abandon, gods as old as the world itself, men of legend and a life all its own, the Ethvold was the mightiest of woods.

But that was in days long past. Now the Ethvold is gone, and only a remnant of it remains, small woods in the north, the Eldwood along the sea and the Darkenfold in the south.

The Eldwood, to the east, holds the heart of the old wood, but the Darkenfold holds its dark memories.

It is an evil wood, filled with its own wild abandon and creatures of ill intent. Those who live there know that the trees and the soil hold memories of their past glory and do not forget the axes of men, orcs, dwarves, and goblins that have plundered them of their wealth and life.

This Codex of Aihrde Expansion explore the length and breadth of the Darkenfold, from the Perth Timberland in the north to the Downs in the south, from the famous town of Ends Meet where Otto runs the Cocklebur Inn and Tavern to Bootstraps where almost anything is for sale.

Mountains of features are fleshed out complete with adventure hooks for almost any fantasy role playing game.

191672.description:
Step into a world of epic storytelling. Take on the role of the traveling bard, regaling the tales of diminutive heroes, long forgotten. Embellish the stories, challenge your rivals, share the lore and the liquor!

The stories of heroes are well established in the annals of bardic lore. A select band of bards have traveled the earth acquiring the legends of the most unbelievable legends of Goblins past. The stories of their conquests are unlike traditional legends, crafted from improbable accomplishments, incalculable risk, and a nearly absurd amount of luck. The epic tales of these forgotten heroes belie their diminutive stature. You have the responsibility of keeping their memory alive by telling their stories to weary travelers at taverns across the land. Creatures of darkest myth, artifacts of untold power, diabolical traps, and recovery from catastrophic misfortune fill your mind and flow from your tongue as you compete for the attention of the audience. Your story-weaving talents will be put to the test as other bards tell the tales of their own chosen heroes and heroines. Keep it lively ladies and gens’ fortune is a fickle mistress!

Each round a player may perform two actions from the following list:

May discard two Lore cards from their hand to draw either one Lore card from the discard pile or one Lore card from the top of the Lore deck, as a free action.

May place a card from their hand to the play mat. (this can be done twice, one for each action)

May draw two cards. (May be done twice, once for each action)

May beg for tips and receive two gold from the bank.

May pay one gold and get one bardic talent card.

At the end of 10 rounds,add the score of all the Lore cards on your Storyboard. Add 5 Lore for each Epic Embellishment card on your Storyboard. Add 1 Lore for every two Coins remaining in your possession (rounded down). Determine if you earned any of your Bardic Talent reward(s) by calculating and comparing necessary rows, columns, or other criteria. Add Bardic Talent reward(s) to your Lore score if earned. The player with the highest Lore score wins the game. Ties are resolved by awarding victory to the player with the most Lore earned from Bardic Talents. Secondary ties are resolved by remaining Coins. If a tie still remains, toast each other’s success and share victory.

Legends of Goblins Past conjures the confabulist in us all. Your flair for the dramatic will be put to the test, as will your constitution. Drink and be merry!
191672.name: Tales from the Taverns: Legends of Goblins Past
boardgamefamily: Card Games: Draw and Discard Games
boardgamepodcastepisode: The First Roll - What's New on Kickstarter? - Episode 65: Monday, September 12th

191673.name: Codex of Aihrde
191673.description:
From publisher blurb:

The world of Aihrde spins upon an earth-like axis of ancient civilizations where good and evil have struggled for countless years. It is a world that bares the markings of its past; where ancient evils slumber, stained with the power of eldritch wizardry; where gods dwell in bejeweled halls of wonderment, worshiped by men and women of all creeds; where dragons live in great dens of heaped treasure; where the new stands upon the ruins of the old in beds of ancient glory.

For a thousand years and more the dark god Unklar ruled the world in a terrible reign of Winter’s Dark. But now, banished to the Great Empty Aihrde is a world reborn.

In the After Winter’s Dark heroes tread in iron shod boots and wizards lean on crooked staffs to plunder the buried wealth and power of the ages. Here, the eternal struggle goes on, age after age, for Aihrde is a world of adventure, of undaunted heroes, untainted by the decadent philosophies of those meek who suffer in the shadows of lesser men. For here the stone columns of history are wiped clean, awaiting the bold to carve their mark and gain entry to the halls of immortality!

Aihrde is complete campaign and world setting for you Castles & Crusades game. An in depth history, mythology, descriptions of all the races of the world, from dwarves to giants and elves to orcs, a case by case study of all the relevant kingdoms and peoples and the geographical regions the live. Aihrde is the most complete campaign setting on the market today.

191674.name: Alone in the Woods
191674.description:
User summary:

Alone in the Woods is intended to present a light-hearted action-based role-playing game that is light on combat and heavy on hijinks. Characters have Attributes (Strength, Dexterity, Constitution, Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma) as well as derived "Statistics" (It Points, Initiative, Speed, etc.) and Skills. However, several notable rules encourage lighthearted or ridiculous play and cinematic action.

191675.name: The Lost City of Gaxmoor (C&C)
191675.description:
From publisher blurb:

North of the Bergruken, upon the broken slopes of the Massif the sun’s fading brilliance outlines the ancient ruins of the once thriving metropolis of Gaxmoor. The former beacon of Imperial power mysteriously vanished ages ago. Now it has returned, beckoning brave adventurers to explore its ruins and crypts, and to vanquish the chaos and evil that lies within.

The Lost City of Gaxmoor is a complete adventure setting that takes characters from levels 1-10. Playable in any home brew setting or in the World of Aihrde!

191676.description: Spaceteam: NSFS Expansion is a 48-card, somewhat adult-oriented expansion for Spaceteam that includes cards such as "Ethanol Probe" and "Greased Apparatus".
191676.name: Spaceteam: NSFS Expansion

191677.name: Behind Their Back
191677.description:
User Summary:
This game requires an even number of players. One person will initially act as the dealer, and runs the process of the game whilst also playing.

Using standard playing cards, each player is assigned a reciprocal mate, and potentially one or more secret lovers. The players then mingle and chat with each other, trying to ascertain who is their lover(s) (if anyone) through private conversations.

Players indicate intimacy through using particular subtle physical signals (for example touching their shoulder or giving a longing gaze). At the end of the game, will you remain with your mate, or will you be rejected if they have noticed you flirting with someone else?

191678.name: A Fistful of Darkness
191678.description:
User summary:

Characters in A Fistful of Darkness have Stats (Attributes) with numeric values, including Control, Endurance, Luck, Skill, and Willpower. Most values start at preset levels. All characters are assumed to have recently gained exceptional powers or abilities.

The game presents an interesting fusion of "super hero" style characters and the American West during the frontier period. The setting specifies the West Coast and suggests either Los Angeles or San Francisco (or a fictional equivalent).

191679.description: Spaceteam: Triangulum Expansion is a family-friendly expansion for Spaceteam that adds 48 cards to the game, which thereby allows up to nine players to play at the same time.
191679.name: Spaceteam: Triangulum Expansion

191680.name: Everything You Do Is Stupid
191680.description:
User Summary:

Players take turns reacting to and describing any action or opinion of another player as being stupid, offering an explanation why each time. These justifications need not necessarily be reasonable, but are willingly accepted.

Play continues in this way whilst a timer measures fifteen minutes. The game ends with the declaration, “Wow, that game was stupid.”

191681.description:
In a mysterious lake, shimmering gloop spirits are causing mischief, leaving even the fierce octopus to swirl its long tentacles in the water in frustration.

In Lagoonies, the players are bold and clever ghost hunters who must dive into this underwater world to collect as many gloop spirits as possible — but this is easier said than done as the spirits are confusingly similar, and where once you saw a globe spirit, a dive in the same spot might now reveal a worm spirit instead. Bring a good eye and fast hand to this ghost hunt!
191681.name: Lagoonies
boardgamepodcastepisode: HLG-EXTRA 5: Spellenspektakel 2016

191682.name: The Great Garbage War
191682.description:
User summary:

The game presents a comedic interpretation of post-apocalyptic gaming where Martians and humans vie for control of an earth that is little more than a garbage dump. Characters are humorously comprised of three components--"You", "Your Robot", and "Your Chair"--each with various abilities. Play involves using all three components as a single character.

191683.name: Slower Than Light
191683.description:
From the Game's Introduction:
Find three to five players. You will each be going on a long journey, travelling far away from the others. You will still be able to stay in contact with each other, although as you travel, the distances between you will become greater, and the time it takes the messages to travel between you will increase. But still, you will continue to write, to maintain the threads of connection.

User Summary:
Each round, players write short letters to other players, alternating between writing a letter and passing letters on. The first letter from one individual to another arrives immediately. The second letter between that same pair will take an additional round to arrive, and so on.

After a dozen or more rounds (around fifteen to twenty minutes) stop writing letters. The remaining undelivered letters still in circulation get passed on to their targets, but these letters should be taken away from the game and read later on in private.

191684.name: The Sign of the Great Old Elder God From Beyond
rpg: The Sign of the Great Old Elder God from Beyond
191684.description:
From the Game's Introduction:
This is a game for two players. One player will take the role of the mad worshipper, bent on manifesting the Great Old Elder God From Beyond here on Earth, and the other will act as the avatar of the Great Old Elder God From Beyond itself. (You may play the game multiple times, alternating roles, at your own risk.)

User Summary:
The avatar secretly decides a physical action that the worshipper must perform in order to summon the eldritch horror of unfathomable doom. The worshipper then asks yes/no questions in order to determine what must be done.
With each successful query by the worshipper, the avatar chooses one of the words they just used. The worshipper can no longer pronounce that word, able only to utter gibberish in its place.
Play continues, optionally using tokens to track progress and force an end-game, with the worshipper attempting to discern and then perform the required somatic component to the summoning spell.

191685.name: Drecksau: Sauschön
191685.description: Drecksau: Sauschön, an expansion for the Drecksau card game, lets players decide how they want to participate in the pig parade, whether with full makeup and styling fit for a beauty pageant or a more traditional wallow in the mud.

191686.name: The Calais Bunker
191686.description:
User Summary:
A game for three or more players, set in occupied France during World War II. The characters are German soldiers manning a bunker on the coast of Calais, just prior to the Invasion of Normandy. One soldier is a traitor (although who this is is not known at the start, and indeed is determined only through cooperative narrative).
The action is driven by scripted radio events over a period of fifteen minutes, at the end of which the characters get visual sighting of the Allied invasion fleet. At this point, each player describes one final statement or action for their character, and the game ends.

191687.description:
In Jungle Party, the animals are splashing down the river at night, and you need to remember where they all are: Which animal is swimming in the river? Which is diving under the bridge?

Who can discover each of the critters out there and more importantly remember where they're hidden. If you move the right animal cards down the right river branch, you can be sure to advance rapidly...
191687.name: Jungle Party

191688.name: Goofball
191688.description:
User Summary:
A game for two players, one of whom plays the Lover, and the other the Beloved.
The Lover is deeply enamoured with the Beloved and makes romantic entreaties, always declaring their love. The Beloved is initially reciprocal but grows more distant as the game progresses. In order to elicit a positive response from the Beloved, the Lover must tear a banknote whilst declaring their love; the further the game has progresses, the more passionate a response the Beloved will give in reaction, but also the more rapid their reversion will be, and the more negative will their default mood be.
The game ends after fifteen minutes with the Beloved leaving the room, and the Lover left to put the banknotes back together.

191689.name: Buster
191689.description:
User Summary:
This game requires a ball. It is essentially a simulation of playing as a dog, in which participants all want to play with the ball. The players sit round in a circle, with the ball initially in the middle and within reach of everyone.
Players can only make one of three canine sounds, indicating pleasure, anger, or loneliness, but must always attempt to play with the ball. When in possession of the ball, players may only use one hand to play with it.

191690.name: Awakening
191690.description:
User Summary:
Awakening is a game poem about sleeping with pleasant dreams and the process of waking up from it.

191691.name: The Azoné Butterflies
191691.description:
From the Game's Introduction:
The Azoné are a tribe of fantastic hunters and warriors, and they have lived at the edge of the jungle since the time of the first reckoning. Each season, as their young men and women approach adulthood, they prepare for the ceremony of Stála, in which the youths demonstrate both their worthiness as defenders and providers for the tribe, and their attractiveness to prospective mates. The Azoné value equally skill in deadly combat, and the ability to construct and wear battle garb of exquisite beauty. It is the balance of these two traits that make the Azoné "butterfly warriors" (or "Tyriá") truly great.

User Summary:
At the start of the game, each player creates three beasts, each with a rating from 1 to 9, for a total of 13 points distributed between them. Then each round, for three rounds, the players choose to split 10 points between the beauty of their battle gear and its effectiveness.
If the effectiveness is not high enough, then the beast could wound the character (with a second wound killing them). But after facing three attacks, it is the surviving player with the highest beauty that wins. However if the total combat effectiveness is too low, then the village will be overrun by beasts in the end.

191692.name: The Volume of Secrets
191692.description:
User summary:

The game is a curious mix of shared experience and individual actions among the players. Various "secrets" are established and their "volume", or relative appeal, is tracked by the use of tokens. These "secrets" draw in Angels and Demons, occult forces, though the game itself is not particularly focused on traditional occultism.

191693.description:
This is the deck composition used by the World Champs. Cards taken from the game, with promo art.


The 2015 Android: Netrunner World Champion Corp Deck features fifty cards of the strongest Corp cards playable in Haas-Bioroid. These cards are collected from the whole of the Android: Netrunner data vault and presented with extended, full-bleed art, as well as a visually reimagined Engineering the Future identity card.

Assembled from seventeen pieces of ice, numerous assets, and a number of highly impactful upgrades, the 2015 Android: Netrunner World Champion Corp Deck excels at the "glacier" strategy, which focuses on protecting your installed agendas – and all your servers – with deep layers of ice and other defenses. Although this type of deck takes tremendous skill and a great deal of practice to fully master, it is also one that newcomers can quickly learn to pilot with a reasonable measure of success.

Fantasy Flight Website Description
191693.name: Android: Netrunner – 2015 World Champion Corp Deck

191695.name: The Working Dead
191695.description:
You work a thankless office job at a faceless corporate entity. Its stark, lifeless cubicles bleed grey into your very soul. Before you can even start your day, an old co-worker wanders into your workspace. He's been long dead but that doesn't stop him from being a distraction. You manage to blow his brains out with a modified staple gun and get back to work. Maybe you can make it to Friday. Maybe.

The object of The Working Dead, a negotiation-driven strategy game, is straightforward: Be the first to earn $250,000 by the end of the week by negotiating for fellow co-workers! Check in on Monday, manipulate others to do your work for you, grab a beer on Friday. Don't let the undead get you down. Use them to your advantage or die trying. Always follow corporate policy — or don't.

191696.name: Murder: A Game About Crows
191696.description:
User summary:

Murder is a highly distinctive role-playing game that finds player characters - crows - attempting to manipulate the world around them that is overwhelmed by humans and their habits. The game includes print-and-play components, some of which are used to randomize character generation by mating two cards. The game uses dominoes for action resolution.

191697.name: Tome of the Unclean Issue #01
191697.description:
From publisher blurb:

Under a sky of blue, lies our vibrant world, where life blossoms in the green spring, or lays in repose in red autumn. But beneath the green, beneath the red, lies the cold, hard ground. Here the roots of things cut the earth, devouring what it holds. Small creatures dig and burrow and worms grow fat on the still dirt. Deeper still lie subterranean worlds, caves, where rock crawls upon spirals of time, creeping from pools of quiet that lap the shores of darkness. And beyond the darkness, beyond all sense, lies a gulf of empty fear, where our demons lurk.

Born with twisted thought, tainted with stains of malice, these are creatures unkempt. Foul of sight and smell, sunk in the darkness of the time's caverns, the dwell in an abyss, in hell, in the Wretched Plaines of shadow and loss. These are the demons. These are the devils.

Kim Hartsfield, author of the wildly popular, Classic Monsters, returns to bring us Tome of the Unclean. Revisiting those demons and devils of the earlier publications you'll find the Demogorgan, Asmodeous, Amon, Mammoth and more in this, the next volume of monsters for your Castles & Crusades game!

191705.name: Memory Quest
191705.description:
User summary:

In Memory Quest one player is the "Agent" and the remaining players are the "Whisperers". The Agent is a terrorist who has had an operative's mind implanted into his subconscious. The Whisperers are the scientists who did it. The game proceeds through turns with the Whisperers using hints to guide the Agent's actions. Two tracks indicate the progress of the game.

The setting and method of play are quite distinctive. The game seems to offer somewhat limited replay opportunities with experienced players, however.

191706.name: Tome of the Unclean Issue #09

191710.description: Catan: Big Box contains the classic Catan board game, along with the expansion that allows up to six players to compete on the base game, the Frenemies scenario, the Helpers of Catan mini-expansion that gives each player a character with a bonus ability, the Mallorca scenario (printed on paper), and the Deutschland scenario (printed on game board, with the city landmarks also being included).
191710.name: Catan: Big Box

191711.name: Air Patrol
191711.description:
User summary:

Characters in Air Patrol are assumed to be heroic crime-fighting adventurers who use future tech, though the game is set in the past - yielding something of a steampunk feel. Characters have Skills and special abilities. Additionally, the game uses a "Risk Dice" mechanic that lets characters expend a limited pool of dice to increase their success odds, but at the possible cost of adding complications.

Note that two versions are available for download; both are functionally identical.

191712.name: Monster High: Monsterkrasses Such-Spiel
191712.description: Players in Monster High: Monsterkrasses Such-Spiel want to collect the eerily beautiful images of those in school in order to complete their photo album — but which monster fits where? Only those quick enough to find the proper photo album page for the images will collect them, and whoever first collects six images wins!

rpgitemversion: Expanded Options #02: Monster Lore for 5th Edition PDF
Sidebar #02: Monster Lore Skill for 5th Edition PDF
191713.name: Monster Lore for 5th Edition
191713.description:
From publisher blurb:

The shambling figure that is coming up the road toward your party should be recognizable as a ghoul to just about everyone in your party. The current rules for 5th Edition however don’t take into account the all-important knowledge skill of monster identification. Peek behind the scenes and see one easy way to give all of your player characters, regardless of class, a bit more
knowledge, and role-playing opportunities with 5e Sidebar #2 - Monster Lore!

Sidebars, regardless of rule system, are written from the perspective of one game master talking to another. Do not expect a collegiate level thesis that dissects the concept. Instead, get ready for a conversation with another Game Master as they explain an interesting and hopefully fun way to run your game!

191714.name: Lil' Cthulhu
191714.description:
You are cultist of Cthulhu and have been summoned before the elder god himself. He has commanded you to perform a task that will siphon off your very sanity... in fact it has already driven your dark master insane. You will take on a task as horrifying as the human mind can endure... you must babysit Lil' Cthulhu.

Lil' Cthulhu is a quick and quirky card game in which 2-5 players take on the roll of Cultists trying to keep Lil' Cthulhu happy, by giving him the toys he is demanding. Sounds simple right? Wrong! Your problem is, he is a spoiled brat with the temperament and tantrums of an elder god who has ripped all of his toys in half.

Your job is reassemble his broken toys by reaching into the infernal abyss that is the Dark Toybox for parts. Act fast, because each time you reach into the Dark Toybox you will lose sanity.

In this fast paced game, to pacify Lil' Cthulhu you will collect and assemble all of Lil' Cthulhu's demands before the other Cultists by backstabbing other players, suffering through his raging tantrums AND before going completely insane.

You will not win. You can only hope to survive.

191715.name: Command Cube
191715.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a little booklet of a Traveller compatible vehicle. The vehicle introduced in this installment of the series is a light mech designed to serve as a command vehicle with some electronic warfare capabilities.

The PDF contains the background of the vehicle and statistics for its use as well as an illustration.

191716.name: Hot Wheels: Track Attack
191716.description: In Hot Wheels: Track Attack, players build a custom track together, then grab a car, and start racing. Luck with the die won't be enough on its own to become champion of the race, though, as players also need to avoid dangers on the track. Whoever first crosses the finish line wins!

191717.name: Barbie: Wer packt zuerst seine Koffer?
191717.description:
What a nice surprise! Barbie's girlfriends have invited her on a short holiday, and they're already on the way to her house to pick her up — but her dresses are all mixed up and the two suitcases that she needs for the holiday are still empty.

In Barbie: Wer packt zuerst seine Koffer?, you need to put together the perfect holiday outfit for Barbie before her girlfriends show up at the door. Can you do it?

191718.name: Rund um die Welt - Eine interessante Rekordfahrt
191718.description: The player wo rolls highest begins and choses a continent to travel (green track). Every player has to chose another continent. Movement is determinated by a die. After completing their continental journey the players go to Berlin to start their race around the world (red track). The first player to return to Berlin wins the game. At some cities certain events hinder or benefit the players.

191719.name: Geometry Strategy
191719.description:
Toy of the Year Finalist for Rookie of the Year, as the only board game!

First player to place their Sphere on the Bullseye is the winner. How hard can that be?
Well, you have 1, 2, or 3 opponents with their sets of pieces trying to stop you, and take you out of the game.
Your Sphere has no defense and at the center of the board there's a Red Zone where everything changes….

Geometry Strategy is a strategic and tactic board game where even the element of luck is tactics.
A brand new classic game, with a Red Zone.

Gameplay:

Each player aims to be the first to place their Sphere on the Bullseye to win the game.
The Sphere must be protected from other players who will try to take it out and thereby put you out of the game. At the same time you must stop the other players from reaching the Bullseye with their Spheres.
For defence as well as offense, each player has 9 pieces besides the Sphere to strategically and tactically play with as the game starts. All pieces have different rankings in challenges between them; though they all are able to capture the opponents’ Spheres.
If you think this doesn't sound hard enough, add a Red Zone where any player can enter and change the conditions of the game. Completely. Now, either you get blind sided by these changes every time, or you prepare yourself and play your game tactically.
Before the game starts, all players place their pieces on their quarter of the board. The Sphere and the Helix, your trump piece, have to start at your base line but the other pieces can be placed on squares of your choice. A Red Zone card is flipped to get the conditions for the Challenges; attacks, by showing the present rankings for the pieces.
Players take turns in a clockwise order. First player starts by moving one optional piece of their own color; one or two steps in any available direction. It is then the next player’s turn, and the game is on. Is your strategy to move your Sphere toward the Bullseye as soon as possible? Or to use your pieces to stop the other players to get there and then run for the goal in the end?
When two players’ pieces are within reach of each other it can lead to a Challenge, or attack, where a player can lose a piece. The piece with the highest ranking according to the present Red Zone condition wins the Challenge and takes the losing piece out of the game.
The players can choose to enter the Red Zone and change the conditions for the challenges.
As soon as a player enters the Red Zone, a new Red Zone card is flipped and the conditions of the challenges can be changed with new ranking orders for the pieces! It can be a good thing for one or more players, but it can also mean any advantage you’ve enjoyed is stripped away.
If a player’s Sphere is challenged, game is over for him/her.
Although, if you think you’re losing many pieces, as long as you have your Sphere you can still win the game.
First player to place his/her Sphere at the Bullseye is the winner!

191720.name: Eye Know Mitbringspiel
boardgameintegration: Eye Know
Eye Know
191720.description:
Eye Know is a visual trivia betting game. At the start of the game, a number of cards are laid out. On a turn, you choose one of the cards and identify the image on it. (This isn't the hard part, but rather a precursor of what's to come.) If you correctly identify the image, you can then choose to answer a trivia question relating to the object named on the card. Questions come in three varieties — true/false, multiple choice, and open ended — and the payouts are higher for the tougher questions.

Eye Know Mitbringspiel includes one hundred picture cards that can also be used as an expansion for the Eye Know board game.

191721.name: Artifact: A Roleplaying Poem
191721.description:
User summary:
This is a role-playing poem for three players. The Victim tries to achieve something. They have access to The Artifact, but are countered by problems posed by The World and The Artifact. When a one-minute timer goes of, one player wins and narrates their ending.

191722.name: Vom kleinen Maulwurf, der wissen wollte, wer ihm auf den Kopf gemacht hat.
191722.description: Vom kleinen Maulwurf, der wissen wollte, wer ihm auf den Kopf gemacht hat. is a memory game featuring the Little Mole, the butcher's dog Hans-Heinerich, and other animals from the children's classic book. Who can find the most pairs?

191723.name: Brass Balls
191723.description:
From the introduction:
Times are tough. Finding jobs ain't as easy as it once was. For each job there'll be a hundred or more folk applying for it. It's a bloody joke. What are you going to do?
You're going to brass ball it. You may not know anything about the advertised position, but you learn real fast, and how hard can it really be?

In this role-playing poem for 2-5 players, one player will play the role of a jobseeker interviewing for a position; the other players will play the roles of the folk interviewing that person for the position.

191724.name: Defenders of the Realm: Winds of War
191724.description: Winds of War is an optional variant for Defenders of the Realm that adds a tracking board and 16 cards to the game. Anytime a Special Hero card is played for its special power, or an "All Is Quiet Darkness Spreads" card appears, it is placed on the tracking board. As soon as the third card is placed, then a Winds of War card is drawn and must be followed. In most cases a negative effect occurs unless the team decides to prevent it by following the demands of the prevention on the card.

191725.name: Amplitude (2016)
videogamehonor: 2016 Golden Joystick Best Audio of the Year Nominee
2016 Golden Joystick PlayStation Game of the Year Nominee
191725.description:
The Kickstarter-backed 2016 release of Amplitude is a reboot of the original 2003 rhythm game from Harmonix.

User Summary

191726.name: Casual Conversation
191726.description:
The game text (CC-BY-NC-SA by oreso):

Specifications: 10 minutes, 3–5 people, No other materials required
Preparation: None

Procedure

• Read all these rules out loud before beginning the game.
• Each player must think of a topic they want to talk about.
• As soon as one player has thought of a topic, then they may start talking about it and cannot be interrupted.
• Try to talk about aspects of the topic: something recent, something that has affected you personally, and a controversial opinion you hold.
• If the specific thing that someone is talking about relates to your topic, you must interrupt them with That's interesting, because... and then talk about it.
• The person who has talked the most at the end of 10 minutes is the winner.

191727.name: Psycho PAF
191727.description:
In Psycho PAF: Channel Wars, you are the president of a TV station, you create your own programming schedule by buying TV shows and their presenters. While trying to gain the highest ratings, you run into scandals, gossip, intrigues and back-stabbing from other players.

The goal of the game is to have the best channel (victory conditions to meet -- see below).

Each turn, the players play 4 actions (among which you can play presenter and TV show cards, take the top card of a deck and discard it, move shows on your schedule, etc).
You can play the positive and negative gossip cards on your own game or on other player's games. The better your TV rating is each turn, the more actions you get to do on your next turn.

You win when, at the end of a turn, all your 8 time slots for the week are filled (including 1 "best evening") and a presenter is assigned to each show. In case of a tie, the highest TV rating designates the winner.

191728.name: The Endless Meta Spiral
191728.description:
From the game text:
Play yourselves as you were two minutes ago. After two minutes, M. says: “We’re sitting down to play this game. It’s two minutes ago.”

191729.name: Emprise
191729.description:
Emprise is a multi-player fast-paced, real-time card game where players race through dungeons looking for treasure and glory. While only one player can hold the top spot, they must rely on their teammates in order to succeed or all will fail.

The object of Emprise is to have the most experience points after a series of levels, culminating with a boss battle.

Each player has a deck of cards with their own crest on the back to play plus their character cards which represent individual powers they can use while playing.

At the start of each round, the players flip over a new level, read the appropriate rules (if any), and deal out the indicated number of monsters for the start of the round. The players then deal out there focus pile and stamina cards, leaving the remainder of their cards as their luck deck.

To clear your focus deck, players simultaneously play with four zones gaining experience points and treasure. These zones are the level (where the monsters are milling about, ready to fight along with the level cards), their focus, stamina, and luck decks.

When a players focus deck has been cleared, unless otherwise noted by the level, the round ends. Players count up the cards played into the field, subtract any remaining focus, and take their hidden treasure which is revealed at the end of the game.

The player with the most experience points at the end of the game, including their hidden treasure, gains bragging rights until the next time the adventures play.

191730.description: At the 2015 Origins Game Fair, White Wizard Games released a version of the Star Realms card Cutter with alternate art. The cost and powers of the card remain the same as the one in the original game, and the card bears a small "Origins 2015" logo in the bottom-right corner of the image.
191730.name: Star Realms: Cutter Alternate Art Promo Card

191731.name: Beast of Balka
191731.description:
It is time to hunt the Beast of Balka! The Sun Clan and Moon Clan are competing to be the first to slay the Beast and earn the favor of their god, and they must navigate a jungle full of monsters — and enemy hunting parties — to do so. Will you be able to use your superior tactics to claim your quarry, or will the other clan get the best of you?

Beast of Balka is a fast-paced abstract strategy game that challenges each player to outwit their opponent, taking into account positioning as well as probability to emerge victorious. However, destroying your enemy is not your goal: simply an obstacle to it.

Each player takes turns traversing the forest, honing in on their prey and trying to hinder one another. The more each hunting party encounters danger, the more bloodthirsty they become; but they must face ambushes, misdirection, and — worst of all — stampeding beasts!

191732.name: Jeopardy! Junior Edition
191732.description: (From cartridge) All new! Junior Edition. Hundreds of questions for ages 7 and up!

191733.name: Anathema: A Roleplaying Game of Death Deferred
rpg: Anathema: A Roleplaying Game of Death Deferred
191733.description:
User summary:

The game manual is divided into three major sections: establishing the setting and concept; creating characters; and Game Master resources. In the game, characters are Shrouds, or a type of in-between spirit something like a ghost but not quite.

191734.name: Dexter's Laboratory: Mandark's Lab?
191734.description:
Game Cover
The evil Mandark has infiltrated Dexter's laboratory, and is intent on its destruction. Using a combination of wits, courage and skill, Dexter must embark on a thrilling quest of mini-games to regain control of his laboratory.

191735.name: The Flintstones: Bedrock Bowling
191735.description: YABBA-DABBA-DOO! Bowling will never be the same again. Thanks to the Great Gazoo, Bedrock is a bowling alley and you've got a seat inside the ball!

191736.name: Pro-Pinball
191736.description:
Game Case

The ultimate and most realistic pinball game ever created for the Playstation. Realistic flippers, ramps, loops, drop targets, grab magnets, sink holes, jet bumpers, and of course, realistic balls.

191737.name: Tesco Hell
191737.description:
"Publisher's Blurb"

Each player plays somebody who needs groceries on a Saturday evening and decides to go shopping at the monster-like store Tesco, a 24-hour shop where they have absolutely everything. Tesco is has a special way of keeping the food fresh: they suck the souls out of their customers. As the customers walk around in the store they will lose more and more of their soul. The challenge is to find what they are looking for before they lose their soul and are doomed to walk Tesco forever.

191738.name: Mystery loves Company
191738.description:
"Publisher's Blurb"

Mystery loves Company is a sitcom-like game about the superheroes Mystery and Company, their kids, and their arch-nemesis Disgusio – master of disguises!

191739.name: Deathbird Black (Alpha Version)
191739.description:
User summary:

Deathbird Black combines a fairly typical hard-boiled "noir" detective genre with outright comedic action. The game uses a scaled dice pool that is atypically used, as well as cards to control play. The dice are used in pairs and various pairs are allocated depending upon the number of players (more players means more dice for each player).

191740.name: Deathbird Black (Alpha 2 Version)
191740.description:
From the introduction:

This is comedy noir. What that means: It is a comedy game set in the 'film noir' genre. Character bleakness, cynicism, pessimism, etc., are thematic. Player bleakness, etc., is counterproductive. Play it for the laughs. Add alcohol if your group swings that way.

User summary:

The Alpha 2 Version of the game adds refinement following early comments after submission to the 24-hour competition.

191741.name: Haunted Version 1 (2011)
191741.description:
User summary:

Haunted utilizes two principle characters for two players and additional shared characters the remaining players utilize as needed and desired. The two main characters are a Murderer and the murderer's victim's Ghost. Place proceeds with the Murderer attempting to resolve his crisis ("get away with it") and the Ghost attempting to get the Murderer caught. Except, only the Murderer can hear the Ghost!

191742.name: Haunted Version 2 (2011)
191742.description:
User summary:

After Haunted received a "runner up" nod in the 24-hour competition for which it was created, the author received extended feedback from two other designers and incorporated numerous changes into the game, essentially streamlining and refining the structure and systems. This "Alpha Draft 2.0" is published alongside the original entry.

191743.name: Survival: Frogs of South Eastern Australia
191743.description:
Survival: Frogs of South Eastern Australia tells the struggle of five endangered Australian frog species: The Southern Corroboree Frog, Spotted Tree Frog, Baw Baw Frog, Stuttering Frog, and the Growling Grass Frog. In this cooperative game, the players try to return and establish stable populations of each species to the wild.

All player's hands are seen only by them, but they cannot play cards from their own hand. Instead they must use the action cards to find out information about the cards held by other players, all while trying to avoid threats to the frogs and their habitats.

The game was developed and designed by 5D (in 2014), 6A (in 2015) and their teacher at Berwick Fields Primary School. Wanting to do something to help endangered frog species, the class launched a two-year learning journey and this game is the product of that. Along the way, the class was awarded the Zoos Victoria Love Your Locals 2014 winner for its work on the game and was inducted into the Zoos Victoria Hall of Fame for Young Wildlife Advocates of the year in 2015.

191744.name: Moral Dawn
191744.description:
From the introduction:

The Moral Dawn is a Roleplaying Game about Angels, or at least people who have angelic powers. Whether they are angels, and whether they believe themselves to be angels, is up to the GM and the players. While the setting is up to the players, too, the central idea is that Angels, are, in fact, normal people who just happens to have supernatural powers. They don't know why they have them, they don't know what they're supposed to do with them. But they know what is good and what is bad. Or do they?

191745.name: MurderWing
191745.description:
From the introduction:

Play the flashy flyboys of the 3rd expeditionary aerial force - the MurderWing. Take to the air and unleash bloody murder on the enemies of Terra!

Soar over the ground pounding grunts and bring death from above.

191746.name: Realization Dawning
191746.description:
From the introduction:

The game is played in a number of game sessions (as few a one, perhaps as many as six). Not all players need to be at every game session. The game is played in a series of established phases.

Players should create a Character, or Characters, open to change. Yes, you are an angel. You believe it to be so, but when realization dawns in the morning you must be open to the possibility that it is not so. And the reverse too, you must be open to the possibility that you are indeed an angel.

191747.name: Uncle Louis Version 1
191747.description:
From the introduction:

Each player takes the role of one of the nobles in Louis’s court, but their identity is kept secret from other players. The aim of the game is get a puppet King installed on the French throne who is beholden to the player’s character for his position. Untold wealth and favors then ensure. The trouble is, all of the other players are also angling for the same outcome with their own man.
