Shuffle up the cards, and hand one to each player; the players should not know which one of them received the card with the spot. The player who received the mark is the first Invader. Their minds have been corrupted by an alien presence, and they will attempt to similarly infect the other, still human, players.

191869.name: The Sword and the Skull
191869.description:
User summary:

The Sword and the Skull presents an interesting political dynamic where a region has two competing rulers: The Sword and The Skull. The Sword espouses goodness, kindness, and self-sacrifice. The Sword espouses corruption, greed, and self-indulgence. The characters are Knights who are tasked with enforcing the kings' edicts. All of them.

191870.name: The War of the Sheaves
191870.description:
User summary:

The game presents a setting generated by group exercise and puts major emphasis on establishing a complex society. Once the creation phase is complete, a more-traditional game master and player process begins where characters interact within the society. The game proposes primarily narrative development though actions can be resolved through a dice pool mechanic. The rules are somewhat rough and probably best suited to a group of experienced role players.

191871.description:
In American Dynasty you will play as one of the grand American political families: the Roosevelts, the Kennedys, the Bushes, or the Clintons. To assert your family’s supremacy you will employ the time­-honored tools of civic discourse, such as manipulation of the media, tactical legislation, calling in favors, back­stabbing, stabbing, and the accumulation and distribution of money. You must build your political engine, sabotage your opponents, and bully and barter your way into the hearts and minds of the American electorate, ignorant of the closed door meetings, and deliberately impassioned by carefully orchestrated media events. By getting your candidates elected to congress, passing bills, and hopefully becoming president, you will crusade against your rival dynasties, sacrificing resources and morality in equal share. Anything, for the good of the family.

GAMEPLAY: The game is played over the course of 5 Terms, and the goal of the game is to collect the most Electorals by the end of Term 5. Each term, players take turns taking 2 actions each (playing Core Action cards or Media Event cards, introducing Bills for voting, and other special) until an Election is triggered. In an Election, players with competing candidates roll dice and add on bonuses they prepared before the Election to determine winners of each vote. Winning candidates then take office and can vote on Bills and other issues. Electorals can be gained in multiple ways, including winning elections and passing bills. Negotiation, trades, bartering, bribes and table-talk are strongly encouraged.
191871.name: American Dynasty

boardgameintegration: Terra
Terra
191872.name: Terra on Tour
191872.description:
Terra on Tour takes players on an adventurous journey of knowledge around the world — but if the players don't know what's being asked about, they can still score by being close to the correct answer. What's more, players also assess the answers given by others, allowing you to score from the knowledge (or lack thereof) of opponents.

Terra on Tour is a standalone game, but the cards included can also function as an expansion for Terra.

191873.name: Untitled Jeepform
191873.description:
User summary:

In the game one player is the Witness (game master), though the role is atypical inasmuch as the Witness typically does not participate in the game but acts as a judge once it is complete. One player is an old soldier, about to die. The remaining players are people who know or once knew the soldier. The game proceeds along a narrative action of the old soldier talking with or remembering scenes, seeking absolution. When the game ends, the Witness determines whether or not absolution was achieved. The game is particularly free-form and has no established mechanism for resolving narrative disputes.

191874.name: Veterans (2011)
191874.description:
User summary:

In Veterans, one player is the Audience (roughly like a limited game master). The Audience gives or takes tokens to the other players.

The other players are Veterans who take turns spinning yarns about their military service. If the Audience likes the story, she or he gives a token to the Veteran; otherwise, a token is taken away. Veterans can try to "one up" a previous story, essentially stealing the token.

When one Veteran loses all her or his tokens, the game ends and the Veteran with the most tokens wins.

191875.name: Welt der 80er
191875.description: Welt der 80er quizzes players about the world in the 1980s, with a record-shaped game board highlighting a media format that disappeared shortly after that time. Players select questions from seven categories and test their knowledge: When did Katarina Witt win a gold medal? What show did Rudi Carrell host in the 1980s? Who was the German chancellor?

191876.description:
Ulm is at its heyday. The construction of the Ulm cathedral has not yet been completed, but the city is already wealthy and prestigious.

In Ulm, players try to expand their spheres of influence and to make optimal use of the hustle and bustle on the marketplace around the cathedral.
191876.name: Ulm
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 031 – All About Airecon
Episode 11 - Notre Dame vs Ulm

191877.description:
In Touria, Princess Tara has decided to marry – but not just anyone, of course. She expects a lot from her husband-to-be: Heroic deeds and precious gifts are a must.

A group of bold adventurers set out to pit themselves against dragons, dig up gems from the haunted mines of the country – and make a good deal from time to time, since the father of the bride demands an appropriate price for his daughter's hand. Touria's dancing towers show the heroes the way, so the brave men and women go from one adventure to the next. Brave women? Of course – or have we forgotten to mention that Tara's handsome brother, Prince Talan, is also of marriageable age?
191877.name: Touria

191879.description:
In Rival Kings, two royal families compete for the country and its people. High-ranking personalities prevent the members of the opposing family from using their subjects for their own purposes and from erecting valuable buildings — but everything comes at a price. Who will lead his family to fame and honor?

Text from publisher:

The position of the leader of the empire is vacant. But who has what it takes to become the new king? In order to increase their power, the contenders for the throne rally the country and its people around themselves.

Who will make the best use of the influence of important personalities and engage his competitors in conflicts without suffering damage himself? Rival Kings is a stalwart card game from HUCH! & friends.

At the beginning of each cycle, each player chooses one Character card and places it face down in front of him. Once all players have done so, they turn them over simultaneously. The Character cards determine the order of play, the number of possible actions, and potential conflicts. Low-ranking characters have more actions at their disposal, but they may act only after the higher-ranking characters. In addition, each character may come into conflict with certain other characters. When this happens, the higher-ranking character may take one action from the inferior character and carry it out immediately; this action is then no longer available to the lower ranked during his turn.

After the Character cards have been played and potential conflicts have been resolved, the action phase begins. Now, depending on the action, a player can take money, get rid of Conflict markers, recruit subjects, or buy a building. Players try to secure good combinations of buildings and subjects for themselves in order to get a high score in the end. Besides this, the subjects recruited during the game provide different advantages that can have a crucial impact on the course of the game. However, only one subject is active per player – if a new Subject card is added, it covers the player's previously laid-out bonus.

The game ends as soon as one of the card piles has been depleted. The player who has collected the best combinations and has as few Conflict markers as possible lying in front of him has the best chance of assuming the throne.
191879.name: Rival Kings
boardgamefamily: Games by the Game Artisans of Canada

191880.name: Skibe
191880.description:
Description from the publisher:

In Skibe, players assume the role of a tribal chief in the days of Erik the Red.

Erik has ordered the building of ships for the purpose of sending the bravest Vikings to Greenland. The players build longboats, supply them with provisions and equipment, and try to bring as many Vikings of their own tribe as possible on board. Will the ship stand up to inspection by all tribal chiefs? And which tribe will be best represented on the ships in the end?

191881.name: Jan & Henry: Das Memo-Spiel
191881.description: With Jan & Henry: Das Memo-Spiel, youngsters can immerse themselves in the stories of Jan and Henry while trying to find where Henry tucked away the birthday cake or where the bed went to. In the end, whoever finds the most pairs of tiles wins!

191882.name: Klappe!
191882.description:
Description from the publisher:

Who has quick-witted answers to the really important questions in life and can make their fellow players laugh in reaction to their profound but absurd answers? You'll find out in Klappe!, but if you overdo it, you can quickly talk yourself into trouble...

191883.name: RaBATz!
191883.description:
Description from the publisher:

Monsters upon monsters! But everybody has brought a different musical instrument for the night-time monster concert. Each card is played in front of the young conductors and covered by the next card. Who will be alert enough in RaBATz! to know which monsters have already been on which stage?

What's more, once a trio has performed and has been recognized correctly, the search changes. Now players need to find three of the same musical instruments!

191884.name: Shopping Queen: Das Kartenspiel
191884.description:
Trends sometimes change faster than you can move!

Which colors are recommended by Guido the trendsetter? What's the new rallying cry? In Shopping Queen: Das Kartenspiel, you're trying as quickly as possible to compile a matching five-piece outfit. But be careful! Taking unwanted fashion advice from other players can make you look pretty stupid...

191885.name: Termite Queen
191885.description: A promo added by the publisher to every copy of the base game until it's out of stock, designed by Mateusz Żbikowski. A set of 4 tiles - one for each player, depicting a termite queen in their colour. The queen lies in player's supply from the beginning of the game. During their turn, in the reproduction phase, a player can - once during the entire game - place their queen on any hex (except for water or stone) instead of a normal termite. When on the board, the queen cannot be attacked, moved, does not attack or support attacks. A player may move through/over the hex with their queen. The quuen can be replaced by any available termite tile belonging to the same player as the queen.

191886.name: Hereafter
191886.description:
User summary:

In Hereafter player characters are recently dead spirits. The afterlife turns out to be not quite what they imagined. Character creation relies primarily upon establishing certain narrative tags to explain what characters were in life, what they loved in life, what the believed in life, how they died, and so forth. Playing cards are used to drive narrative events; each suit is aligned with a particular "domain" (physical, intellectual, emotional, or spiritual).

191887.description: Die Westklippen (The Western Cliffs) is a blank map for Chada & Thorn, with a start, end, and two middle stages. The cliffs lie between the meadows and the port of Narkonna on the island of Narkon. You may add your own movement values and effect icons to the paths on the map.
boardgameaccessory: Die Legenden von Andor: Chada & Thorn
191887.name: Die Legenden von Andor: Chada & Thorn – Die Westklippen

191888.name: Shopping Queen: Das Würfelspiel
191888.description:
Description from the publisher:

The candidate of the day is traveling back and forth across the city while you're working in her home, trying to use the funds available to build up the wardrobe of this candidate to match the three special goals before the candidate returns. Who will manage to roll the best outfits in Shopping Queen: Das Würfelspiel?

191889.name: Die Legenden von Andor: Der Unbekannte Krieger
boardgameexpansion: Legends of Andor: Journey to the North
191889.description:
Der Unbekannte Krieger (The Unknown Warrior) is a blank hero for Legends of Andor. You may fill in its dice, rank, and special abilities. It differs from the first blank hero, Legends of Andor: The Stranger, by having four willpower rows (like the Tarus from Legends of Andor: New Heroes).

A standee (but no board) for this hero is included with Legends of Andor: Journey to the North; the board is available as a free PDF download.

191890.name: Fun to Go: Fragen über Fragen
191890.description:
Description from the publisher:

Based on the familiar traveling game of "I spy with my little eye", Fun to Go: Fragen über Fragen challenges most of the players to guess what the active player is seeing on their card by asking only questions that can be answered either "yes" or "no".

191891.name: Eternal Journey: New Atlantis
191891.description:
Travel from the deepest trenches of the Atlantic Ocean to the awe-inspiring wonders of Mars as you solve the greatest archeological puzzle known to man: the origin of Atlantis. Begin this epic sci-fi journey in the present as you guide Amrite Stone on her latest dig, and then continue it 150 years in the future when she wakes up from cyro-sleep following an unexpected tragedy. As you explore the scientific installation, you’ll use video clips and journal entries to piece together the events that resulted in the disappearance of every human from the base, befriend a lonely cat and encounter an alien life form more terrifying than man has conjured in his most outlandish tales of the future. Through stunning production values and cunningly designed puzzles, Eternal Journey: New Atlantis will draw you into an experience unlike any other hidden object adventure!
Download and play

Source: The Developer Website.

191892.name: Fun to Go: Auto Lotto
191892.description:
Description from the publisher:

Where is a red car, a blue bus or a yellow truck driving? Whoever finds the sought vehicle first gives a yell and scores points for spotting the target. Whoever watches most closely and spots the most cars in Fun to Go: Auto Lotto will win!

191893.name: Gigi Gnomo
191893.description:
Description from the publisher:

On a walk through the woods in Gigi Gnomo, the players come upon the gnomes' family treasure — but Gigi Gnomo vigilantly guards and defends the riches. If a player doesn't watch out, he'll be bewitched by Gigi and suddenly can do things only with his left hand, has to hold his right ear lobe, or run once around the table. Will Gigi's spell last for one round — or possibly for the entire game? And who will be able to cast off the spell and take the treasure home?

boardgamehonor: 2017 As d'Or - Jeu de l'Année Nominee
191894.description: More than one thousand items from all walks of life can be guessed through the use of 61 transparent cards in Imagine, whether they're placed next to one another or superimposed. Almost everything in the world can be represented by a simplified concept — just don't speak while you're playing...
191894.name: Imagine
boardgamepodcastepisode: #24: The HYPE Episode! Gen Con 2016 Preview; Rocky Road a la Mode preview; Among the Stars on tap
#27: The Networks review, Friday on-tap; The Beer Traveler: Asheville
28 – The Family Gamers Podcast – Boston FIG Tabletop games
Episode 32 - Holiday Gift Giving Guide
Pandemic: Reign of Cthulhu Review

191895.name: Toddles-Bobbles
191895.description:
Toddles-bobbles is a fun and dynamic game that develops imagination and attention. It is good for little ones and those who are long over… It’s fun for any age!

Have you met Toddles-Bobbles yet?

here they are! 12 charming characters! They are cute and friendly, very different and they don’t have a name! What name shall we call them? That’s how the game begins.

What is the game about?

The players take turns to draw a card from the pack and open then. There is a picture of a Toddle-Bobble on the card. If this Toddle-Bobble appears for the first time, the player who opened the card gives him a name. Everyone needs to remember this name. The player who remembers the name correctly and is the first to shout it out next time when the Toddle-Bobble comes up in the game, will claim all the open cards to his winning pile.

Let’s see who is going to have the best collection of Toddle-Bobbles portraits! And who is going to come up with the funniest name?

191896.name: Washizu Mahjong
191896.description:
It plays like Riichi Mahjong, but needs a whole different set of tiles.

1/4 of the tiles are opaque and 3/4 are translucent.

So, the strategies are a lot different since you may see about 3/4 of the tiles in your opponents hand.

Variant from the Manga Akagi, and there are sets made exclusively to play this particular variant of the game.

191897.name: Jan & Henry: Das Geräuschespiel
191897.description:
Description from the publisher:

Jan and Henry have once again been hearing strange noises! In Jan & Henry: Das Geräuschespiel, players assume the role of one of the meerkats and describe to the other players the sounds they hear or they imitate the noises themselves. Who can guess the most noises?

191898.name: Roller Derby Final Jams
191898.description:
Roller Derby Final Jams (RDFJ) is essentially a race game based on the sport of Women's Flat Track Roller Derby.

RDFJ components include skater cards depicting jammers and blockers from two rival teams. Players will use custom dice and team assist disks to navigate their jammers past their opponent’s blockers in order to score points before time runs out in last few remaining jams of a closely contested derby bout.

Optionally the game can be customized by removing the skater cards that come with the game and then substituting trading cards available from some roller derby leagues. This allows players to simulate competition between actual roller derby teams.

191899.description: Kill the Overlord: Anarchist is a promotional character for Kill the Overlord that bears the following power: "Give 1 gold to the Overlord during the Income Phase. If you have no shield cards, you may play any book card as if it was Revolution - all Active Players randomly switch roles and the Execution ends."
191899.name: Kill the Overlord: Anarchist

191900.description: Kill the Overlord: Conspirator is a promotional character for Kill the Overlord that bears the following power: "At the start of the Round, all other players close their eyes. Players with book cards raise their hands."
191900.name: Kill the Overlord: Conspirator

191901.description:
Description from the publisher:

The dwarves are loose in Clonk!, with many valuable crystals to dig up from the cursed mine, but a sinister danger is lurking in the dark corners. Who will manage to collect the most valuable load in their wagon and exit the mine unscathed?
191901.name: Clonk!
boardgamefamily: Games by the Game Artisans of Canada

191902.name: Crime Master
191902.description:
Description from the publisher:

A bank heist in Berlin-Tegel, a painting theft at the Stuttgart state gallery, a corpse in the inner harbor in Hamburg — these cases and 22 others from 25 cities in Germany, Austria and Switzerland are really demanding. The mysterious crimes in Crime Master can be solved completely only by the cleverest investigators.

191905.name: Die Villa des Paten
191905.description:
Description from the publisher:

After months of investigation, there is finally enough evidence against the notorious "Godfather" to put the cunning criminal behind bars for good. The question remains, however, how he can be arrested.

In Die Villa des Paten, only a team of smart as well as resolute policemen can manage to eliminate the ruthless gangsters and to penetrate the lion's den.

191906.name: Family Flutter-By
191906.description:
Description from the publisher:

The Flutter-By family enjoys the summer day and flutters back and forth across the meadow — but you are looking only for specific butterflies! By skillfully folding the flaps on your butterfly board up and down in Family Flutter-By, different colorful butterflies come up. Who will be the fastest to discover the right butterflies?

191907.name: Pocket Mortys
191907.description:
Join Ricks throughout the multiverse as they get swept up in the latest craze: Morty training! There are over 70 bizarre Mortys to recruit and train out there, including Mustache Morty, Wizard Morty, Cronenberg Morty and more. Assemble a dream team, then challenge rival Ricks by forcing your grandsons to battle each other. Command, combine and level up your Mortys to prove that you're the greatest Morty trainer of all space and time!

- Discover dozens and dozens of bizarre Mortys across the multiverse of Rick and Morty
- Train and combine your Mortys to level them up and watch them grow
- Battle rival Ricks from across the multiverse
- Encounter your favorite characters like Bird Person, Mr. Meeseeks and more
- Craft items and engage in tedious side quests
- Win prizes at the space arcade Blips and Chitz

Source: The Game Website.

191908.name: Shopping Queen: Das kleine Quiz
191908.description:
Description from the publisher:

What regulates the drawstring? What was the lowest amount a candidate on Shopping Queen ever spent on her outfit? How often did Guido Maria Kretschmer give zero points? You'll find these and other questions in Shopping Queen: Das kleine Quiz. Learn the detailed answers and exciting knowledge about one of the most beautiful themes of world.

191909.name: 5 Seconds
191909.description:
Description from the publisher:

In the quick and witty word game 5 Seconds, a player has five seconds to give three valid responses to a question, and if they do it, they advance a space on the game board. If they don't, then the next player gets to take a crack at the same question — but they can't repeat any of the previous answers given, and they still have only five seconds to spit out their answers!

Whoever crosses the finish line first wins!

191910.name: Chicken Wings
boardgameimplementation: Chicken Wings: Glow in the Dark
191910.description:
Description from the publisher:

Necessity is the mother of invention in Chicken Wings because when the hot plate starts burning in the kitchen, those chickens want to get away from the kitchen lickety-split.

Luckily the kitchen has plenty of tools at hand, so they turn a wooden spoon into a catapult, and with one wing aiding another, they launch their poultry pals out the window. A good throw is only half the battle, though, as not all landing spots outside the kitchen are equally good, so you want to aim carefully...

191913.description:
Description from the publisher:

Death Grip is kidnapping innocent citizens in the city, but there is hope! A new hero – Crimson Crush – is in town, and he will use his special powers to put an end to Death Grip.

In Crimson Crush, you play your cards smartly to score points with the hero, while trying to have Death Grip kidnap citizens to give negative points to other players.
191913.name: Crimson Crush

191914.name: The Grave Digger
191914.description:
Take control of shovel-master Fagus in this curious blend of whimsical English comedy and grim Dickensian horror

Source: The Developer Website.

191916.name: Cubeo
191916.description:
A fast-paced abstract dice game for two players where no die is thrown.

Although this game is referred as board game, no board is needed. Just a bit of flat surface and set of distinguishable 6-sided dice, six for each player.

The main objective of both players is to put dice on the surface, create a single formation from them and either block an enemy to be unable to perform any of valid actions, or be the first player available to merge the dice whose value is more than 6.

At the beginning, both players put one die with one dot upwards on the playing surface in a way that both dice touch each other by a side. Then during each turn a player can perform one of the following actions:

1. Add a die into game - newly added die cannot touch any of the opponents' dice,
2. Move the die around the existing formation - die moves around the perimeter of the remaining dice on surface,
3. Merge the dice - player removes one die of his own and promotes an adjacent dice by value of the removed one.
a) There must be at least 3 dice of yours in play to do this!

Every player must keep in mind that every die on surface has to be adjacent to at least one another die.

Whenever a situation occurs that player on turn can merge dice whose value is larger than 6, he becomes a winner.
A player also wins, if his opponent on turn cannot perform any of the actions mentioned above.

191917.name: WorldShift
191917.description:
In the 21st century, a mysterious object lands on Earth ending all known civilization. WorldShift is set thousands of years after those events, when the human civilization is no more than just a fading myth. The remains of the mysterious object, known as Shard Zero, are still spreading its Plague and reshaping the Earth. The human race has developed a new culture and is now living in five shielded mega-cities, struggling to survive from day to day. The rest of the Earth is populated by what is known to be the Tribes, successors of the early humans that were affected by the Plague, and the Cult, a mysterious alien race with unknown origins.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/WorldShift WorldShift]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

191918.name: Jurassic Park 3: The DNA Factor
191918.description:
From Wikipedia: A cargo plane flying over Isla Sorna is struck by lightning, and upon crashing, the dinosaur DNA it stored is spread across the island. The player then assumes the role of either Mark Hanson (a photographer) or Lori Torres (an ace pilot), and must wander around the island in a side-scrolling format, collecting DNA and avoiding dinosaurs.[1] In each level, the player's character has the ability to switch between a background and a foreground pathway. Switching between the two pathways allows the player to access weapons and DNA samples,[2] or to avoid oncoming dinosaurs. At the end of each level, the player will use the DNA that is collected in a short puzzle game, in order to create more dinosaurs. Completing this minigame will unlock more areas for the player to explore. At the end of the game, the military bombs the island, and the player escapes on a small plane, wondering if dinosaurs should really have a place in their world.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jurassic_Park_III:_The_DNA_Factor

191919.name: Den of the Glacial Bear
rpgseries: Into the Wintery Gale: A Vikmordere Saga
191919.description:
From publisher blurb:

An Into the Wintery Gale Mini-Dungeon adventure for four to six PCs of levels 8-9.

This mini-dungeon is intended for use with the Into the Wintery Gale: Wrath of the Jötunn adventure path, but may also be run as a standalone quest.

In this adventure the party is approached by a gravely wounded Vikmordere Warrior wandering through the wilderness. He stumbles towards them, collapsing to the ground and reveals that he and his three brothers were hunting when they were attacked by a glacial bear. His kin are badly wounded in the lair of the beast and he implores the adventurers to help save them!

191920.name: Snowblind Sanctuary
rpgseries: Into the Wintery Gale: A Vikmordere Saga
191920.description:
From publisher blurb:

An Into the Wintery Gale Mini-Dungeon adventure for four to six PCs of levels 9-10.

This mini-dungeon is intended for use with the Into the Wintery Gale: Wrath of the Jötunn adventure path, but may also be run as a standalone quest.

Whilst traveling near the mountains and seeking shelter from the relentless and unending blizzard the adventures discover a tunnel carved into the mountainside. The tunnel leads to an abandoned shrine built by an ancient sect of Vikmordere shieldmaidens who formed a cult worshiping a mysterious wintery spirit.

191921.name: The Jotunn Encampment
rpgseries: Into the Wintery Gale: A Vikmordere Saga
191921.description:
From publisher blurb:

An Into the Wintery Gale Mini-Dungeon adventure for four to six PCs of levels 10-11.

This mini-dungeon is intended for use with the Into the Wintery Gale: Wrath of the Jötunn Adventure Path, but may also be run as a standalone quest.

The party has returned to the village of Völsfiheimr and are asked to assist in another matter before continuing on their quest. A Vikmordere scouting party has discovered an encampment of Jötunn-kin several miles away, and suggest that all attacks in the area are being coordinated from location – a long abandoned Vikmordere fortress.

Canute believes that if the encampment can be neutralized, it would thwart Jötunn advancement and provide the Vikmordere with a battlefield advantage. He provides the adventurers with a crude map pinpointing the location of the encampment.

191922.name: The Ways of the Old
rpgseries: Into the Wintery Gale: A Vikmordere Saga
191922.description:
From publisher blurb:

An Into the Wintery Gale Mini-Dungeon adventure for four to six PCs of levels 11-12.

This mini-dungeon is intended for use with the Into the Wintery Gale: Wrath of the Jötunn Adventure Path, but may also be run as a standalone quest.

In this adventure the party is seeking information about an ancient artifact known as the Sorrow’s Snekkja. Vikmordere legends suggest that it can be used to quell the evil which dwells within Serpent Lake, but provides few hints of its form or whereabouts.

191923.name: Roadkill
191923.description:
Description from the publisher:

Each player owns a road. To win, keep the fewest roadkill or truck cards at the end of each round. Roadkill is a game of cheap shots, compulsive cleaning and payback.

191924.name: The White Wyrm Awakens
rpgseries: Into the Wintery Gale: A Vikmordere Saga
191924.description:
From publisher blurb:

An Into the Wintery Gale Mini-Dungeon adventure for four to six PCs of levels 13-14.

This mini-dungeon is intended for use with the Into the Wintery Gale: Wrath of the Jötunn Adventure Path, but may also be run as a standalone quest.

In this encounter the adventurers have met the Hvíturiddare “White Riders” clan of Vikmordere and witnessed their unusual practice of riding into battle on the backs of gargantuan winter wyrms. When the party earns the trust of the White Riders, the clan reveals to them that only very special wyrms can become mounts, and even then only with the use of wyrmreins. These particular creatures only appear within an ancient holy shrine located in the northern mountains—a sacred place known to them as the “Ormurhellinum.”

191925.name: El Bandido
191925.description:
Description from the publisher:

A light-security prisoner is trying to escape through tunnels starting underneath his cell. Will you be able to join forces and cards to stop him? El Bandido is a cooperative game of strategy and observation for the entire family.

191926.name: WineIQ
191926.description:
Description from the publisher:

WineIQ is the ultimate game for wine lovers, letting everyone shine and have a good time. The two levels of difficulty and the ability to play in a team make it a very sociable game. In the first round it comes to your knowledge; in the second to your memory. From the classics to the forbidden wine napa in Casablanca, from the wine to the glass, with this game you will discover fascinating things.

191927.name: Apparition
191927.description:
From publisher blurb:

There's no such thing as unbeatable security, not even when dealing superhumans and their homes, vehicles, or other toys. Don't think Apparition is good enough to get at what you're hiding in those oh-so-impressive vaults? She's just waiting for the opprotunity to prove you wrong. Part of being the best is knowing you have prove it. Constantly.

Apparition is a PL 10 thief extraordinaire to add to your Mutants & Masterminds campaign.

191928.name: MusicIQ
191928.description:
Description from the publisher:

MusicIQ is the game for all music lovers that lets everyone shine and have a good time. With 400 multiple choice questions covering a period from the late 1960s to the present, answers are counted as positive and negative IQ points. From the Beatles to Stromae, from vinyl to streaming, from the golden age of hip-hop to world music, from Miles Davis to Ben Harper, this game will help you discover fascinating stories and facts.

191929.name: Another Fatal Love Story
191929.description:
From publisher blurb:

When Rana and Drake met, it was love at first sight. And for about two years that love was intense. Sweat-stinging your eyes kind of intense. But those are just chemicals in the body tricking them into believing they are in love. And when those chemicals wear off and they look over to the person lying in bed with them… Well?

When they realize they don’t love that person anymore, it’s time to move on. Except Rana doesn’t want to move on. She wants Drake dead. Rana would have a hard time explaining exactly why. Maybe she doesn’t love him, but she doesn’t want anyone else having him either. Or maybe he’s been disrespectful one too many times. None of that really matters. She just needs her friends to help with the planning, execution, and disposal. What could go wrong?

Protocol is a series of story roleplaying games that thrusts characters together into dramatic situations. Each game uses the same set of rules, with vastly different parameters, start points, characters, and finales. Players take on the roles of directors outside the action and characters inside the action, using the ebb and flow of four different scene-framing styles (vignettes, interrogations, interludes, and ensembles) to tell meaningful stories about characters in crisis.

Each game in the Protocol series is zero-prep for 3 or more players. The game length is exponentially long, so games with more players take more time to complete. The Protocol Series requires a deck of poker cards as well as tokens to track drama points.

The Protocol One-Sheet Series do not include rules, only charts. Each game requires players to own at least one game in the Protocol series, or Protocol Prime.

191930.name: Grand Tour Europe
191930.description: Grand Tour Europe is the game for travel lovers who want to discover the countries and cultures of Europe. The players answer questions using their cards that represent countries, but no need to be a know-it-all to win. The two types of questions — speed and knowledge — make the game fun and accessible. Correct answers let the players advance from country to country and beat the other players to win playing pieces and victory points. The player with the most points at the end wins.

191932.description:
Exposed is a quick 2-6 player game in which you're a thief who has snuck into a boat party with the aim of stealing as many wallets as you can without anyone exposing who you are. If you steal enough wallets or you're the last player left unexposed, you win!

The playing space is a grid of tiles depicting the guests at the party, such as a fireman, physicist, or accountant. You're one of these guests, but no one knows which one is you. Each guest has a wallet, which you can steal from them if you are adjacent. Each move you make gives away information about who you are, so you have to decide how aggressive or sneaky you want to be so that your identity can remain hidden while getting as many wallets as you can.
191932.name: Exposed
boardgameexpansion: Exposed Character Pack: Tools of the Trade

191933.name: Apotheosis Blues (Version 2)
191933.description:
From the introduction:

Apotheosis Blues is role-playing game set on a post-holocaust Earth. Civilization has collapsed. High technology is rare where it isn't nonexistent. Petty warlords reign where once there was the rule of law. Creatures out of nightmares roam the world seeking to devour the unwary. All of these genre cliches are familiar to anyone who has ever played a post-apocalypse RPG or watched any of the dozens of post-holocaust movies. But Apotheosis Blues differs from its predecessors in one critical respect. The disaster that ruined the World of Man wasn't nuclear or biological or even environmental. The world of Apotheosis Blues came about because of a spiritual holocaust.

User summary:

Version 2 of the game adds many refinements and additional content to the original version.

191934.name: Apotheosis Blues Character Sheet
191934.description:
User summary:

The Apotheosis Blues Character Sheet is provided as a Microsoft Excel workbook that can be filled in and printed. The spreadsheet does include some formulas but they must be edited before they are functional. A text file distributed with the spreadsheet provides basic instructions.

191936.name: D100 System Core
191936.description:
User summary:

The D100 System Core presents a fairly straightforward mechanism for resolving actions in a tabletop role-playing game. The rules present a traditional, but minimal, Attribute-Class-Skill system. Resolution utilizes a d% roll that is modified. However, the modified result is compared to a simple action table and each digit signifies a particular result such as success or failure, degree of same, and hit location (for combat).

191937.name: The Starlit Kingdom
191937.description:
Publisher blurb

Many, many centuries ago, the people of Earth co-existed with the people of the Moon in peace and harmony. This might surprise you, as the Moon queendom was a place rich with beauty and full of wonders, not the least of which were its people, who were blessed with magic and long life. It might seem natural that the people of Earth would look upon their neighbors with jealousy, but the people of the Moon shared freely of their gifts and kept to themselves. It was thought that this golden age would last forever.

Such is the complacency that peace brings.

It Comes To This

It may be that the golden age of humanity will crumble. It may be that Elysium will fall into civil war or declare war on the Moon queendom. The future is not yours to read. All you know is that you have been called to fulfill a sacred duty and you will uphold that duty even at the cost of your life.

The Starlit Kingdom is a game in which you tell tragic stories about the fall of a magical kingdom. It is based on Thou Art But A Warrior, which is powered by the Polaris system, by Ben Lehman of TAO Games.

191938.name: Bullshit Quiz
191938.description:
The Bullshit Quiz is a game about populism and right-wing extremist positions. It's satirical and tries to sensitize the players for extremist views or statements. The populists in the game and their statements are original ones from current social debates in germany. The game is designed by the authors of a famous satirical news site. They've also created the Minderheiten-Quartett.

From the publisher (translated and abbreviated):
Welcome to the Bullshit Quiz - the interactive crashcourss in Populism.

The game consists of 2 phases:
In the Quiz-Phase quotations of right wing populists are read out, the players must guess who said it (out of a selection of 4). The winner takes a bullshit card.
In Phase 2 players must a create a funny sentence with their bullshit cards, which is then rated by the others.
The game includes cartoon drawings and short biographies of the 30 populists.

From the publisher:
Herzlich willkommen bei Bullshit Quiz - dem interaktiven Crashkurs in Rechtspopulismus.

Haben Sie das Gefühl, nicht von Ihrem Normalsein zu profitieren? Haben Sie es satt, dass sich Politik und Medien immer nur mit den Problemen von Minderheiten beschäftigen? Sind Sie auf der Suche nach einer beruflichen Veränderung?

Werden Sie noch heute Rechtspopulist!

Dazu müssen Sie nicht in teure Ausbildungscamps nach Russland oder Sachsen reisen. Sie können das Populisten-Handwerk auch ganz bequem und spielerisch im heimischem Wohnzimmer erlernen: Vom Sesselpupser zum Opinion-Leader in nur 60 Minuten!

Das Spiel besteht aus 2 Phasen.


In Phase 1, dem "QUIZ" gibt es abhängig der Spieleranzahl unterschiedlich viele Runden. Ein pro Runde wechselnder Quizmaster


liest ein zufälliges Zitat vor. Die Spieler müssen nun aus einer Auswahl von 4 Populisten wählen, wer diesen Bullshit von sich gegeben hat.
Die Spieler die richtig geraten haben, bekommen eine Bullshit-Karte.


In Phase 2, dem "Bullshit", kann jeder Spieler nun den Populisten nacheifern.


Aus den erhaltenen Bullshit-Karten bildet man einen möglichst lustigen Satz, der von den anderen dann bewertet wird.
Die Wertung der Mitspieler + der Bullshit-Faktor der Karten werden addiert und bilden die so eine Endwertung.

Durch die Quiz-Runde erfährt man viel von den Populisten (Steckbriefe enthalten).
Die Zitate sind gut ausgewählt und mit Quellenangabe hinterlegt.
Die Populisten sind durch schöne Karikaturen dargestellt. Die Spielanleitung ("Book of Shame") ist klar geschrieben und einfach verständlich.

191939.name: DIP-Styx
191939.description:
User summary:

The concept behind the structure of the game is that new players often find character creation tedious and confusing. Thus, play begins immediately and character development happens "when it happens", during play. Players begin with tokens that are spent during play to gain some type of character Trait or ability. These Traits are linked to dice pools for action resolution.

191940.name: Meridian: Age of Invention
191940.description:
Experience the wonder of discovery as you rebuild a crumbling kingdom in Meridian: Age of Invention, an innovative time and resource management game! To renovate rundown villages, you'll have to hire workers, scour for resources, repair infrastructure, provide food and other services, engage in trade and create machines that will make life easier for the people. To win a gold trophy on each level, you'll have to use your ingenuity to figure out the quickest way to gather resources and complete your other tasks.

As you travel through lush grasslands, arid deserts and a village built on the sea, your guide will be Professor Cardano, an eccentric but brilliant inventor. Along the way, you'll meet many other zany characters, all of whom have their own dreams you can make come true. Endlessly imaginative, visually stunning and accessible to players of every skill level, Meridian: Age of Invention will take you to a time and place you'll never want to leave!

Source: The Publisher Website.

191941.name: Rescue Team 5
191941.description:
Join the world famous Rescue Team and set off on an adventure you'll never forget! Once again, people in peril are looking to the men and women of the Rescue Team to save them. Use your time management skills to work quickly to remove the obstacles that stand in your way, to rebuild ruined infrastructure, and most important of all, to free those in danger! As you make your way through a desert wasteland, snowcapped mountains, and a danger-filled jungle, saving lives and rebuilding cities with carefully planned clicks of your mouse, you'll earn over two dozen achievements that bear witness to your heroism! Your journey will end at the foot of a rumbling volcano that's threatening to blow. Can you make it there and save the day in the explosive finale? Join the Rescue Team today and find out!

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgamecompilation: Spyfall: The Box Is Not Enough
191942.description: A new location for Spyfall. The Spy will surely be stumped when he finds himself amongst a crowd of board game geeks!
191942.name: Spyfall: Gaming Convention promo cards

191943.description:
Paris 1800 allows players to play as the great figures of the nineteenth century Romantic and Modern, to decide the future planning of the capital. Modern transform the city by expanding its boulevards, creating monuments in iron and glass. Romantics will preserve the old quarters of bourgeois ambitions by using the dissatisfaction of the people of Paris.

One player is the Modern ans plays Haussmann and two police chiefs
Others players are the Romantics (1 Romantic per player)

Turn Sequence :
1 - Rewards : Modern gains money ; Romantics gains "Inspiration". Romantics draw 1 Revolution card when the Time Cube (grey) is on a Revolution dot
2-Move : players can place their tokens on the board
3-Actions : Romantics do their Actions first. They can:
a-Go out of France (Exil)
b-Go in Fontainebleau Forest
c-Pay for deliver a Romantic in the Fortress
d-Raise the angry of the Parisians by put an "Angry token"
Bonus : if there are 5 adjacent Angry tokens , 1 of them can be substituted by a Revolt token
e: Find Haussmann and gain 3 VP
f : If Romantics succeed their Revolution goal, they gain 8 VP

Modern can :
a-Go to the City Hall to obtain a building permit
b-Go to the "Beaux-Arts" Academy to have a Project
c-Renove a district. Haussmann must be in this district., and this district must match with the Project requirements and the building permit. This action also costs some money and Modern gains victory points (VP)
d. Pacification : a Modern token can discard an "Angry token". On a Police token can be in a revolted district and remove the token. It costs 2 millions.
e : Jail a Romantic : can be done by a Police token which is on the same district than a Romantic token, which is placd in the Fortress.

All the players can : Open/Close the Magazine in Montmartre and Go to the Observatory to change the Move Order.

Victory : there's a score track at the left of the board. The winner is the faction which have 20 VP before the end of the game or its depends of the position of the scoring cube on the track at the end of the game (1910).
191943.name: Paris 1800

191944.name: Garden Rescue: Christmas Edition
191944.description:
Rescue the Christmas trees from swarms of ravenous insects.

The winter came, but wily beetles are hungry for vengeance. They are ready to pay any price to ruin Christmas for the garden dwellers!

On Christmas Eve you have a chance to get into the thick of a battle between beetles and plants - the two archenemies. Despite the cold spell, beetles are rushing to take revenge for their recent defeat. Help the plants to stop them!

Winter is a hibernation time for insects, but not in our garden! It will be hot here again this winter, beetles are launching a full-scale offensive. This time they are aiming at the Christmas trees. All garden dwellers are ready for the defense. You are given a unique chance to head this "Green Resistance". New bonuses and a chance to get new trophies are at your disposal, don't miss such an opportunity!

Source: The Developer Website.

191945.name: Kung Fu Hotel
191945.description:
User summary:

The combat system in the game is designed for one-on-one tournament style combat, and does not require a game master. If the game also is utilized as a role-playing game then a game master is needed to facilitate the narrative development. The role-playing aspects are focused on getting characters from one tournament to the next and developing rivalries along the way.

191946.name: Modos Roleplaying Game
191946.description:
User summary:

The Modos Roleplaying Game is an unusually detailed and complete game system presenting a generic, universal system adaptable to any genre. The Fantasy genre is presented as the default - other genres would require development of resources, etc. Production qualities are high. Characters have Abilities and Skills, and gain levels through play.

191947.name: Hi-Jack
191947.description: Hi-Jack is an abstract strategy game, played in a 6x6 or 8x8 square board. It is a territory game. Players take turns placing pieces in the board; those pieces exert influence (i.e. claims) over adjacent spaces. Players score at the end of the game for the territory rhey influence more than their opponents. Highest score wins.

191948.name: The Throne
191948.description:
From publisher blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 285th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a group of thrones amidst a ruined castle in snow covered landscape.

The map is 14 x 20 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 4 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 2016x2880 pixels in size at 144dpi.

191949.name: The Serpent of Hillcamp Woods
191949.description:
From publisher blurb:

A victim of the archdruid Tarnagost, Syahasi is a giant constrictor snake awakened a decade ago and left to wander in a world that suddenly made horrible new sense. Since then, she has settled in Hillcamp Woods, becoming a boogeyman figure to the nearby villages. She learned to focus her senses in her woodland home and developed skills for hunting very dangerous game indeed. For years, she preyed on travelers passing through her forest, so locals learned to stay out of the woods. Now, she must go further afield in search of prey.

191950.name: Era: The Consortium Core Rulebook
191950.description:
Humanity has left Earth over a thousand years behind, landing on a new planet and founding a new government. The Consortium is an inspiring ideal: three star systems teeming with life and four species living and working together. As time passes, however, cracks are showing in the Humanity-led society, and those less scrupulous have taken power.

Enter at any point in 500 years of playable story, following the Consortium’s growth from a small colony to a multi-system economic and political establishment. Explore new worlds and encounter alien races, direct or fight in battles which span a solar system and will decide the future of the Consortium or join a Resistance movement against the government to save or destroy billions of lives!

What you decide will define the future of the Consortium!
This book contains the full story of the Consortium’s history, a complete guide to character creation, a list of implants, weapons, equipment and spacecraft encountered in the Consortium universe, the rules, complete with worked examples and a section for the GM which contains everything from sample campaigns to premade characters.

-Source: From the back of the book.

191951.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Borg Cube With Sphere Port Premium Figure
boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game
191951.description:
Star Trek: Attack Wing – Borg Cube With Sphere Port Premium Figure is two expansions in one, with one of them being an oversized Borg Cube (20cm on each side) that also has ship cards and tokens for Cube 384 and the accompanying Sphere 936.

The other half of this expansion is a cooperative scenario in which 1-5 players can battle against Cube 384, whose actions and attacks are automated and random!

191952.name: 12 Labours of Hercules IV: Mother Nature
191952.description:
User Summary:
Another set of adventures in the 12 Labours of Hercules series. This time King Midas comes to help you, turning wood into gold. Als Megarra (Hercules wife) shows a fondness of gardening, since a lot a dead trees can be found, which she then revives. And finally, Hercules gets an "Evil Twin" as one of the Gods "mirrors" (using a Golden Mirror) an evil opposite into existence.

Gameplay and style much like the previous versions.

191953.name: The Minipeople RPG
191953.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game are quite small (about 12 millimeters). Characters have Stats (Attributes) including Strength, Agility, Wits, Perception, and Charm. Stats have numeric scores distributed form a points pool. Characters also have Skills, motivations, and equipment. The game provides basic combat rules and action resolution rules. While the "minipeople" live in the modern human world, their experience appears to be mostly based in a fantasy genre.

191954.name: Wanderlust
191954.description:
User summary:

Wanderlust is set (more or less) in a modern genre though characters have magical powers they can access through song. Characters have a "Career" that encompasses their basic essence and drives. The premise of the game is based around characters that don't ever spend much time in a single place, instead preferring to wander from locale to locale and see what happens along the way.

191955.name: Traction Park
191955.description:
Author's summary
Traction park is a puzzle role-playing game that takes place in a hazardous amusement park.

This is an out-loud text-adventure game, adapting the tradition of the games people used to play on the computer for use with a group of people instead of as a computer game. One person acts as the computer, and the rest of the players share the role of one player character. Recommended for ages 8+ Number of players: 2-5

191957.name: LoveBeat
191957.description:
Love Beat is a free online rhythm action game.
It’s easy to play and fun for all, so what are you waiting for? Don't just stand there, let's play the game!

- Game System
There are plenty of songs for both beginners and masters.
Feel the beat and enter the notes at the right timing!
Now let's dance to the music!

- Fashion Style
Cute, sexy, romantic, and comical styles! You can try every style in the Love Beat shop.
There are over 10,000 items, from baby shoes to lovely tiaras. You will lose track of the time just looking through those items. Show off your fashion style and be the true star of the dance party!

- From Friends to Lovers
We have various game modes and emotional expressions for lovers.
You can choose your partner in the Date Party Mode. Expressing your love to your loved one is also a big part of the Love Beat experience.

- Various Game Modes
You can enjoy 16 game modes including Team Dance Battle Mode, Couple Mode, and Hardcore Mode.
There are also exciting modes like Passing the Bomb, Jump Rope, and Avoiding the Trap.
Beat your rival with the help of your friends.

Source: The Developer Website.

191958.description:
The Powering Up! expansion takes Tesla vs. Edison gameplay to a whole new level by infusing exciting new systems and introducing both a sixth player and a solitaire variant! Fans of the game will delight in exploring:

Building a headquarters. What is a good electric company without state-of-the-art facilities such as a laboratory, works, office, and studio? Each option offers different bonuses and rewards to the enterprising player!
Responding to historical events. Dipping into the rich treasure trove that was the 19th century War of Currents, 21 real-life events add variety and flavor to every play. Exciting opportunities to fight for! Catastrophic calamities to recover from! Woe is the unprepared electricity capitalist!
Empowering the women. Seven historical ladies join the gentlemen to engage in the War of Currents. Important female entrepreneurs, engineers, and artists are now available to draft for each company. Plus, one of these luminaries, trailblazing philanthropist Madam C.J. Walker, becomes the sixth player!
A solitaire robot challenges the solo player with dynamic play!




The enhancements offered by the Powering Up! expansion bring new layers of strategy and fun to the Tesla vs. Edison experience without significantly lengthening game time.

So get ready to power up!
191958.name: Tesla vs. Edison: Powering Up!
boardgameexpansion: Tesla vs. Edison: Powering Up! – Bonus AI Pack
Tesla vs. Edison: War of Currents
boardgamepodcastepisode: 21 – The Family Gamers Podcast – The #TeamCap Show
25 – The Family Gamers Podcast – Solo play

191959.name: Pro Basketball Manager 2016
191959.description:
Pro Basketball Manager 2016 is a comprehensive and realistic basketball management game. Take control of your favorite club and lead it to the summit of the biggest leagues in the world. It is up to you to manage your club: from training to transfers, taking in such aspects as finances and team goals, and not forgetting your direct instructions during matches!

TAKE CONTROL OF ONE OF THE 1,000 PLAYABLE TEAMS!

In Pro Basketball Manager 2016, you can choose to start your career at the head of a well known team such as Los Angeles or New York, but you can also choose to coach a college team or, indeed, a team from anywhere in the world. The choice is yours! In addition to training your own club you can wear two hats at the same time and train a national team!

MORE THAN 70 WORLD COMPETITIONS IN WHICH TO TAKE PART!

From the US college championships to the renowned national American league, through the European leagues, but also African, or Asian, numerous competitions are playable in Pro Basketball Manager 2016. In addition to the national competitions available to your club you can also compete in international competitions!

EACH LEAGUE HAS ITS OWN RULES

Each league has its own rules and these have been faithfully reproduced in Pro Basketball Manager 2016. Your bosses fix your seasonal goals, which you can even set higher!
The recruitment process applied to your team will differ completely according to the league in which you play. If you run a non-professional team, in which the players are not paid, you must convince players to join your side by showing real interest in them. Whereas in the North American league, you will have to handle all the complexity of contracts, exceptions to avoid paying the luxury tax, not to mention trades or the draft. Finally, in the other leagues you will have to manage the buying of players, loans or free agents, taking care not to exceed the payroll allocated to your team for the season.

SCOUTING, TRAINING, FINANCES ... NUMEROUS PARAMETERS TO MANAGE YOUR TEAM

Send your scouts to check out players around the world through an in-depth scouting system. Train your players collectively, but also individually in order to get the best results. Improve your club's finances by improving your arena... many possibilities are open to you to make your club the most famous on the planet!

2D AND 3D MATCHES IN WHICH YOU CAN GET INVOLVED

Once your team is prepared, you can attack the season and play all matches live! You can choose to watch the matches in 2D or 3D; check the condition of each of your players; make substitutions and even adjust your strategy at any time during the match. You are, thus, able to change your defense or offense tactics, and also to change the next play that will be made by your players!

YOUR OWN ON-COURT PLAYBOOK!

Pro Basketball Manager 2016 allows you to greatly deepen your experience as a coach by letting you create your own plays, which you can then use live during matches. Set your imagination free, it's you the play master! If you are taking your first steps as a manager, you can also get help from an assistant who will handle the most complex tasks for you.

NUMEROUS INTERACTIONS BETWEEN PLAYERS AND COACH

Each player has his own personality and his own affinities with such and such a player or club. This will influence his desires and his mood and, as manager, you must find a happy medium.

THOUSANDS OF STATISTICS AT YOUR DISPOSAL!

Be it individual players or teams, you have a whole range of statistics at your finger tips that allow you to manage your progress. You can thus check on the mental or physical state of your players, evaluate your own career, or even look back through the archives on each match, both for your team or another. A comparison tool even allows you to instantly compare two players.

A CUSTOMIZABLE INTERFACE

The game interface reflects your team and adopts its colors! You can also customize your coach profile: name, age, nationality, image, etc.

COMPARE YOUR RESULTS WITH THE COMMUNITY

Check out your stats, such as your total number of victories or the list of your achievements. And thanks to an online ladder, discover how you are ranked against other Pro Basketball Manager 2016 players.

MAKE CHANGES TO THE GAME VIA THE DATABASE EDITOR!

Pro Basketball Manager 2016 includes a database editor that allows you to change the names of teams and players throughout the game, letting you create your own universe. You can also download the databases of other players from around the world and use them for your own matches.

Source: The Developer Website.

191960.description:
Fairy Tale Chess is for people who want to add an air of uncertainty to their chess games.

Unlike normal chess, Fairy Tale Chess uses a deck of Chance Cards that are drawn at the start of every player's turn, with results ranging from the helpful to the disastrous.

Follow the basic rules of Chess except where stated.
191960.name: Fairy Tale Chess

191961.description:
Harry Houdini is throwing a dinner party for the world’s greatest magicians. To make this evening more special, he has prepared a unique delicacy — poutine! Unfortunately for everyone at the party, Houdini is a terrible cook. Each player must use their skills in magic to escape from the party without hurting Houdini's feelings.

Houdini's Poutini is a competitive game in which each player represents a group of five magicians. They must collect a combination of item cards with which they can perform magical escapes from the party. The Houdini card will mingle about the party, making it more difficult to escape the party without hurting his feelings. You must use your skills as a magician to get your entire group free from the party before time runs out and the poutine is served. When only one player remains or time runs out, anyone who was unable to escape must politely choke-down Houdini's ill-prepared Franken-dish.

A variation on rummy with a splash of Old Maid with lots of screwing over your opponents, Houdini's Poutini is a fast-paced and exciting card game for any with a strong mind and stronger stomach.
191961.name: Houdini's Poutini
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode #9 – Houdini’s Poutini

boardgamehonor: 2016 Golden Geek Best 2-Player Board Game Nominee
191963.description:
In Thunder & Lightning, players take on the role of Thor or Loki and fight their way through an army in an epic mythological showdown. Because Loki has already stolen Odin's Crown, the Allfather has entrusted his son Thor with his prized ring of power, Draupnir, to help him defeat the vile trickster. But who really has what it takes to gain control over both relics and therefore claim the throne of Asgard?

Thunder & Lightning, a reimplementation of Hera and Zeus, features the same gameplay as the earlier design, but with larger decks of cards with a different distribution of powers.

In the game, each player starts with nine cards in hand, then places three cards face down in their first row, with these rows butting against one another and each player having space for four rows in their playing area. If a player loses a card in a row, then any cards in the same column behind this card slide forward to fill the empty slot. On a turn, a player has as many action points as the number of columns they have in the playing area. They can use these action points to draw cards, play cards to the battlefield, play a mythological card for its power, or challenge an opponent's card.

To challenge, the player chooses a card in their first row that abuts an opponent's card, then reveals both of them. Most cards have a strength value (0-7), and the card with the lower strength value is discarded, with the opponent's other cards in the same column then sliding forward.

If a player cannot use all of their actions or has no actions (due to having no cards on the battlefield) or loses control of Odin's Crown/Ring, then they lose the game.
191963.name: Thunder & Lightning
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 25 - What Do Those “X’s” Stand for, Again?
Episode 26 - The Must Play Two Player Games of 2016…as of June
Episode 37 - Our 2016 Enthusiastic Seals of Approval!
Episode 73- Two Player Games

191965.name: Will Fight for Food
191965.description:
Jared Casey Dent was a wrestler in a down-and-out bloodstained middle American town.

He lost his own tournament in disgrace and vanished into the night.

Now he’s back, and he’s going to set his life straight using one of these time tested techniques:

Brutal violence / His wavering, hamfisted brand of subtle persuasion / Side questing for loose change / All of the options

Source: The Developer Website.

191966.name: Waterloo Squares
191966.description:
Waterloo Squares is 2-player entry-level wargame of the battle of Waterloo 1815 played on a map which represents the historical battlefield.

One player assumes the role of Napoleon and takes command of the French, the other player represents the Wellington/Blücher combination and will command the Allies (British, Dutch/Belgian, minor German states and Prussian)

The Light Blue and Dark Blue counters represent the French forces, the Grey counters the Prussians and the Red counters all the other Allied forces. All counters contain information denoting their type (infantry or cavalry), combat strength and historical designation - which is only used during setup.

The map is divided into 100 squares, each of a single terrain type - Clear, Woods or Buildings - each of which has a somewhat different effect on movement and combat.

Each square can only contain a single counter. Movement and combat between units is regulated and triggered by playing cards from a personal deck which can be manipulated according to a player's chosen strategy.

Players take turns until one player achieves one of his victory conditions at which point the game ends and he's declared the winner.

191967.name: Farándula
191967.description:
Farándula is a central pool deck-building game where each player take the rol of a participant in a Yellow-Program. In this yellow program, Famous are willing to do anything for fame. False pregnancies, homophobic remarks, car accidents ... Nothing is too low or vile as to not use it either to score points for yourself or to try to sink the other players' score.

But do not let the subject scare you. In essence, Farándula is a deck-building game with more than enough complexity to keep you entertained. Build your deck from a central pool with juicy exclusives and fill other players' decks with everything you do not want. To win you just have to have more Fame points at the end of the game. With 6 different audiences to pamper, Farándula offers a variety of playstyles to try each game.

So, whether you have a dark sense of humor or you just like deck-building games, you should take a look at Farándula!

Spanish Free Download http://bcpjuegos.com/descargas/

191968.name: Peace. A Wargame.
191968.description:
Politics is the art of the possible.
War is politics by other means.
Peace and war. War and peace.

Take the role of the leaders of European major power in the times of Napoleonic Wars. Try to negotiate the most favourable peace, but remember sometimes war might be the only way, leading to it.

Players form partnerships or alliances, which then compete for assets: political influence. Those could be gain through diplomacy, (spending diplomatic actions) or war (spending military actions). Players move their playing pieces to vie for influence on the board representing 19th Century Europe. Influence can also be gained by completing diplomatic or military missions, shown on cards.

The alliances are not very stable, so each turn may see other set of players cooperating.

The winner is the player, who can fulfill set of ambitions of the Empire he or she is representing.

191969.name: Sorcerer Archetypes Vol 1 (Class Archetypes)
191969.description:
From publisher blurb:

A new promotional issue of the Player Paraphernalia provides two archetypes for the Sorcerer Core Class, the Geminis which gains access to 2 bloodlines at a cost and the Battle Mage which prefers to be in the thick of it and finds the chaffing of armor enjoyable.

191970.name: Crypts & Creatures Campaign Adventure: The Ruins of Zikx
191970.description:
From publisher blurb:

Let the Adventure Begin!!

Welcome to The Ruins of Zikx! This is a campaign adventure designed for four to five characters at level seven, whose total combined levels should be between 26-33. The difference between this book and the Dungeon Adventures series is that this is a narrated campaign story. The Ruins of Zikx was specifically designed for use with the Shaleria Campaign Setting book. The majority of this story takes place within the Orwid Swamp, east of the Great Ga'Ruun Empire. It is highly advised that the GM read the Crypts & Creatures: Shaleria Campaign Setting book before running this campaign adventure. The following is a description of the “dungeon shorthand” used for each trap and some monster abilities.

After a deadly encounter in the dwarven town of Shagour, the players have stumbled upon a dark secret which had been hidden for centuries, away from the prying eyes of the world. The local inhabitants have been raised on the legend of Orwid Swamp: an unknown deadly disease that spread throughout the land long ago, and the rise of the undead from the dark murky waters. Now, the players find themselves being called upon to put to rest the twisted foulness of the swamp once and for all. Information from the local sages leads the players to a
crazy witch living on the edge of the swamp, northeast of town. She will help, but can she be trusted? Can the players solve the swamp's dilemma before they become too involved in undead and magical politics? Will they discover the ancient powers and treasures of the Orwid? Can they survive the intense powers at the heart of the Ruins of Zikx?

191971.name: Crypts & Creatures Shaleria Campaign Setting
191971.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the greatest land of High adventure!

The role-playing fantasy world of Shaleria is a place where the wildest adventures and the greatest stories meet. Here the most ferocious magical beasts roam and conniving villains plot their most evil schemes; where magic can be your ally, but a good sword is your best friend.

Inside is everything that you’ll need to start your exciting adventure with materials designed for GMs from beginner to expert levels;

Full color maps of all 11 countries that exist on Shaleria.
History and crests of the realm and nations.
Nine Special points of interest.
New details of the Gods of Shaleria and how they function.
Details of various famous NPCs.
Generic NPCs, everything from common bandits to grand wizards.
Campaign Adventure: Good Deeds is included.

191972.description:
Description from the publisher:

Renaissance Europe is coming together, and people have realized that even the most powerful dynasties can achieve more together, so members of those dynasties are marrying, trading and sharing with one another — but who will end with the biggest piece of the pie?

In Dynasties, players must make many compromises, whether acting on their own or reacting to the behavior of their fellow players. In addition to these tactical and strategic decisions, luck also plays something of a role as not every marriage brings the windfall expected. Perhaps then another marriage will bring more success and influence?
191972.name: Dynasties: Heirate & Herrsche
boardgamepodcastepisode: clp050 – cubelove podcast – Dynasties Heirate & Herrsche

191973.name: Shingal
191973.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Shingal!

After years of persecution and discrimination on Earth, on the worlds of Earth Sector, and in the settled areas of Clement Sector, a group of Yazidis decided to leave the civilized worlds and colonize a new homeworld. Setting in the AXO-305 system in the Solon Subsector of Ariel Sector, the Yazidi separatists founded the independent colony of Shingal.

Quick Worlds 27: Shingal comes with detailed descriptions and maps of the Shingal system and the planet itself. UWPs and a map of the Solon subsector are also included to provide a basis for future adventures in this unsettled frontier. It also features political, legal, and cultural details designed to get your characters directly immersed into the action as fast as possible!

Quick Worlds 27: Shingal has been designed with the busy Referee in mind. Shingal is an interesting and exciting place that can be easily added into any existing Traveller campaign. While Shingal has been designed to fit into our Clement Sector setting, it can be easily adapted to fit into any Traveller campaign with ease.

191974.name: Uprising of the Undead
191974.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Filbar Quest series continues with FQ8 – Uprising of the Undead. As you continue to pursue the lost pages from the Codex of Gamber Dauch (Daw-sch) you quickly discover that the dead have risen from their graves. A rogue mage known as Mortatus the Wicked has discovered the emerald pages from the ancient tome and is using the powerful magic to raise an army of the dead. Your cleric had better be in good graces with their deity!

This adventure setting was designed for 1st/2nd Edition AD&D for the Filbar Quest Campaign for a group of mid-level adventurers and DM. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign!

191976.name: UP
191976.description:
Other than being colorful and fun, this game has no relation to the hit Pixar film. UP is a unique abstract game for 2-6 players that combines the strategy of limited actions, with the luck of dice, and the joy of building blocks. Games last about 30 minutes. Basically, you're all building one stack of multicolored dice and moving your pawns up the stack along paths of color that match your pawn.

You start out with a handful of dice. There's no numbers on these dice, just 6 different colors; and the dice themselves are different colors. You have to get rid of all your dice to win the game, but you also have to be the highest pawn on the stack after you've used up all your dice.

The color that you roll determines where a die can be placed on the stack (that's the luck part), but rather than spending a die, you can use your turn to move or rotate a die that's already on the stack (that's the strategy part). You might want to move a die to open up a path for your pawn to climb higher, or rotate a die to make it harder for an opponent.

The competition gets hotter as the game progresses, and there seems to be a good "catch the leader" dynamic, so that by the end, everyone is often at the edge of their seats to see if a lucky roll or a tricky maneuver will win the game.

boardgamehonor: 2016 Golden Geek Best Card Game Nominee
2016 Golden Geek Best Solo Board Game Nominee
191977.description:
Description from the publisher:

The Hundred Years' War is over and the Renaissance is looming. Conditions are perfect for the princes of the Loire Valley to propel their estates to prosperity and prominence. Through strategic trading and building, clever planning, and careful thought in The Castles of Burgundy: The Card Game, players add settlements and castles, practice trade along the river, exploit silver mines, farm livestock, and more.

Additional comment:

This game is #1 in the Alea very small box series.
191977.name: The Castles of Burgundy: The Card Game
